programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A critically injured Borg is rescued and begins to show signs of emotion and personality, leaving the ship's crew debating whether they should return him to the collective. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.desc: The story of how two of America's most infamous outlaws joined forces and tried to make their fortunes with a string of daring robberies. Western, starring David Rogers, Ryan Browning, Rachelle Lefevre and Michael Biehn

programme.title: Dr Terror's House of Horrors (1965)
programme.desc: An enigmatic stranger offers to read the fortunes of five men he meets on a train, leading to a sequence of twisted tales. A werewolf prowls a stately home, a man discovers his new bride is a vampire, a living plant envelops a house, a musician dabbles in voodoo and a disembodied hand menaces an art critic. Compendium of horror stories, starring Peter Cushing, Christopher Lee and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Plague of the Zombies (1966)

Featuring a soundtrack by Queen

programme.desc: Three women try to rebuild their lost friendship by exploring a deserted island they first visited as children. Thriller, directed by and starring Katie Aselton. With Lake Bell and Kate Bosworth

Martin Amis-scripted sci-fi thriller, starring Kirk Douglas, Harvey Keitel and Farrah Fawcett

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill Christmas party is not far off, but Okaro has more serious things on his mind and orders his officers to step up the hunt for the serial killer. Rickman promptly makes a beeline for her prime suspect Shane Pellow's house - unaware of what awaits her. Young gets a nasty surprise as she hands out her wedding invitations and Bradford takes a personal interest in a child abuse allegation

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Locked in a car boot, Cass Rickman is driven to a darkened warehouse where she will come face to face for the first time with the Sun Hill serial killer. As the Cop Idol party gets into full swing and Klein decides to tell Cass how he feels about her, will her absence set off alarm bells in time to save her life? Meanwhile, Young digs up more dirt on Gilmore's wheelchair-bound boyfriend Carl that could shake his trust in him forever. Drama, starring Suzanne Maddock

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The euphoria of Cop Idol night soon fades as Rickman's whereabouts remain a mystery, and the discovery of her handbag in the street prompts a full-scale search. It seems everyone's worst fears could be confirmed when a woman's body is dredged from the Thames - is Rickman the Sun Hill serial killer's latest victim? Meanwhile, Taviner and Hollis are called to a domestic incident aboard a houseboat which threatens to turn very ugly indeed

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Feelings run high as the Sun Hill team believe they really have got the serial killer this time and forensics raise hopes they can prove the man in the cells is the man who murdered Cass. Klein plans to confront the suspect _ can he maintain his professional detachment or will personal loss and chemical dependency push him over the edge? Best discovers that undercover work is not always glamorous when he's assigned to forestall an armed robbery in a department store following a tip-off and bad memories come flooding back for Gold when she helps a boy caught up with bullies while Ashton breaks shocking news to Gilmore

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An unusual advertisement appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local gazette, purporting to reveal details of a forthcoming murder, including the date, time and venue. It appears to be a morbid practical joke, but proves shockingly accurate. Puzzled by the mystery, and with more suspects than he can shake a stick at, Inspector Craddock quickly enlists Miss Marple's help in solving the crime. Joan Hickson stars

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A mysterious saboteur tries to stop Kembleford winning the Three Counties choir competition. Return of the 1950s-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as the Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest investigates the mysterious death of a beekeeper. Nigel Planer guest stars in the 1950s-set murder mystery series

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest must race to save Bunty from the hangman's noose when she is tried for murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Emer Kenny

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Murder proves to be no laughing matter when Father Brown visits a jesters' convention. Whodunit, starring Mark Williams as the sleuthing priest, with Neil Pearson and Paul Copley

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a glamorous beautician accused of killing her former lover, a plastic surgeon who had threatened to ruin the launch of her new book

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A veteran comedian is found dead in a sealed fallout shelter. Locked from the inside of the concrete bunker with no other means of exit, all clues point to suicide, but Maddy Magellan thinks otherwise and calls on the services of professional illusionist Jonathan Creek

Guest starring Paul Rhys

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: After last week's dramatic cliffhanger, viewers might be forgiven for thinking dedicated Yorkshire sergeant Catherine Cawood had reached the end of the line in Sally Wainwright's dark drama - but with two episodes still to go, it's clear the story isn't over yet. The repercussions of the attack are felt far and wide and while Catherine remains critical, Ann is discharged from hospital. The net finally closes in on Kevin and Ashley - but Tommy is still at large. Sarah Lancashire, Steve Pemberton and Siobhan Finneran star

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate when young lawyer Emily Proctor is found axed to death in Hyde Park. They are led to the chambers of a human rights barrister who was having an affair with her, and it isn't long before the victim's seedy double life involving Internet porn and dark family secrets emerges. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Samuel West

programme.desc: A gossip columnist is murdered after threatening to expose a fashion house's secrets, leaving the sleuthing priest with a fresh mystery to solve. Whodunit, starring Mark Williams

Crime drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Sarah Smart and Duncan Preston

programme.title: Mamwlad
programme.desc: The story of Margaret Haig Thomas, one of Wales' most prominent suffragettes, the shy girl from Monmouthshire who became a militant campaigner for the vote for women. During a lifetime of adventure 'Lady Rhondda' survived the sinking of RMS Lusitania, was jailed for planting a chemical bomb in Newport, and went on hunger strike in support of her political views. She also became one of the most successful businesswomen of her time. Ffion Hague talks to Haig Thomas's biographer, Professor Angela V John, about her subject's life and how her work continues to inspire females today

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.title: Countryfile

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Brodie Castle in Scotland, and meets a family of bagpipe makers. Treasures include a cane with a concealed compass and telescope, an engraved silver salver awarded to a local engineer, a pair of rare 18th-century silk shoes, and a watch that saved someone's life. Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Jaggers makes Pip an offer of a new life in London - but he soon comes to realise the horrific cost that must be paid for his rise in society. As his education begins, he discovers that Estella is due to be married - a revelation that Jaggers hopes to use to his advantage. Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
programme.desc: An android-hunter working for the Los Angeles Police Department discovers a long-buried secret, which leads him to track down former detective Rick Deckard, who's been missing for 30 years and is linked to the case. Denis Villeneuve's sci-fi thriller, the sequel to Ridley Scott's 1982 classic, starring Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford, Ana de Armas and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gaby Roslin and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A claw hammer containing the killer and victim's DNA is the key to cracking a murder. Plus, a burglar who photographs himself in the act leads police straight to his door

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A hand-reared aardvark is reunited with her family for the first time since birth, but keepers are not sure whether she will be welcomed or perceived as a threat

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts heads to Suffolk, where he finds himself charmed by a two-bed mid-terrace that has remained largely untouched over the years. He is less enthusiastic about a two-bed semi in Bedfordshire, however, in which he discovers several worrying cracks in the walls. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin is off barnstorming in Kent to look at the development potential of an enormous plot of land

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a firm that makes wooden standing frames for people with spinal injuries. With Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: The fraudsters taking out expensive phone contracts and leaving others to foot the bill, and how Companies House is being abused by criminals - to legitimise their wrongdoing leaving innocent people to deal with the fallout. And there's plenty more advice and tips along the way. Presented by Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A mother and daughter in Surrey call on the help of interior designer Kunal Trehan and the virtual reality design studio for advice on what to do with their dark and dingy hallway

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is in the Welsh Marches with a couple who want to find a new home with enough land to be self-sufficient. They also visit a community gardening project

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a pottery wheel, a transforming tea stand and a set of port hole mirrors

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Charlie Mackesy's popular illustrated book about a boy and his animal companions, who share a series of brief but profound conversations on the nature of friendship as they journey together in the youngster's search for home. With the voices of Tom Hollander, Idris Elba, Gabriel Byrne and newcomer Jude Coward Nicoll

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat. Presented by Alex Jones and Emma Willis

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lily is nervous ahead of her 20 week scan and Ricky is panicking about being a dad. Kim begs Howie for forgiveness but he won't listen. Suki and Eve return from their business trip and Vinny gets Eve involved in planning a surprise party for Nish

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the audition round of this year's cookery competition. The nine contestants must each prepare a Family Favourite dish, which John and Gregg will sample in a special tasting room - with no clue which cook prepared which meal. After they have chosen their three favourites to fast-track to the next round, the remaining contestants will be set an invention test

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace Ellis investigates the punishment shooting of a young McIntyre drug runner, and her old skills as a social worker help get the evidence she needs to bring charges against the gang. However, she is stalled by a senior colleague, who makes it clear that she should back off. When Gordy pulls away from Angela, she becomes desperate for help

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The judges test the contestants' commercial potential in song production, with the six singers paired up and challenged to rework and remix their partner's signature track. Once they've finished in the studio, they will then have to showcase their reworked song live in front of their rivals and the judges, before one pair are challenged to perform against each other to stay in the contest

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and Jake organise the biggest gender reveal party the north-east has ever seen but nerves set in as Charlotte is behind schedule leaving Jake alone to entertain the guests. As Letitia's shock diagnosis starts to sink in, Charlotte and her mum have an emotional heart to heart

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and her mum argue as they get to grips with the diagnosis but all is forgiven when they go wig shopping in London after Letitia's first treatment. At Crosby Manor, the builders are in to start planning the new nursery and Charlotte faces the fact her mum might not be at the birth

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: DNA on a shoelace links a man to a series of violent attacks at music venues. Plus, police crack a case by finding coded information in a spreadsheet that leads to a hacker

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The threat of a deadly disease forces the keepers to take action when the ankole cattle have to be screened for TB, a dangerous challenge for the biosecurity team and the keepers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned in Wakefield, West Yorkshire; Bintree, Norfolk and Folkestone, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Ochuko Ojiri lead two teams competing at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, as they hunt for potentially profitable items to take to auction. Presenter Christina Trevanion monitors their progress and also looks at the art and history of Persian carpets

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville will be investigating the very latest scams doing the rounds, and taking some of the biggest names out there to task. Plus, top tips and advice on everything from getting companies to take complaints seriously to make sure customers' money is protected

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Newcastle call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead for advice on how to bring some style and character to their bedroom

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a buyer find a new lease on life in the countryside. Now her sons have fledged the nest, today's buyer has her sights on Devon or Dorset

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers bring their items to the Bidding Room. Sophie brings in a rugby shirt from the film Chariots of Fire and James hopes to sell a truck door. Next up, John and Nicky present a coin operated ride on train and car to the dealers and George brings in a 20th century card table with a secret drawer. Plus, Barry comes in with some stained-glass panels

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ed Gamble on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by The Green Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Emma Willis present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve gives Suki the cold shoulder and has had enough with hiding. Stacey panics over her money troubles while the Slaters and Branning's gather for Lily's gender reveal party. Ravi is in big trouble with Nugget

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the competition the designers are split into teams of two to makeover two wooden lodges used as wedding accommodation on the banks of Rutland Water in the East Midlands. With one team working on the bridal lodge and the other on the groom's room they have £3,000, an army of tradespeople and just two days to create a winning design that will impress Michelle and guest judge Shayne Brady and secure them a place in the semi-final

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The cooks are asked to create a dish inspired by their favourite celebrity chef. The pressure is on as only the best will remain and get to fight for a place in this week's quarter final. With just four places up for grabs, the remaining chefs have to cook a dish with layers to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: A journalist offers Costello an exciting opportunity while she works at the peep show and she throws herself into the challenge while trying to keep her and Iris afloat. Gloria forms an unlikely connection at work, derailing her good behaviour and Selby reconnects with some old friends

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: The crew look forward to a fresh start in the new year but the upcoming debutante ball threatens some already fragile bonds. Julien settles into life at Nick and Zoya's and Monet comes up with a plan to ruin things

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Things get complicated when Gideon agrees to hold a dinner party to impress Roy's client and Zoya starts to spend more time with Shan's family. Obie returns to Constance Billiard after avoiding his friends over the winter break and Monet attempts to install a social hierarchy at school.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor and Joe Crowley are in Sherwood Forest to unravel some hidden histories of this nature reserve and site of special scientific interest. Margherita finds out the role Sherwood played as a training ground in the First World War, while Joe discovers why Sherwood has a missing generation of oaks and how premature ageing is helping to fill the gap. Plus, why the new deal for Northern Ireland hasn't included veterinary medicine, with potentially devastating consequences

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The gardening programme returns, with Carole Baxter, George Anderson and Diana Yates assessing the state of the garden after winter and starting the many jobs that need done at this time of year. Calum Clunie reports from his allotment in Leven, while Brian Cunningham provides an update on his garden at Old Scone and there are also tips to save money in the garden

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: The return of the countryside and rural affairs programme. Dougie Vipond attends a ploughing competition in Fife as the farming season gets under way, while Arlene Stuart meets competitor Carol Jack to find out if she's got what it takes to be a champion plougher

programme.title: Easter from King's
programme.desc: The Rev Dr Stephen Cherry leads the traditional celebration of Easter recorded in the candlelit Chapel of King's College, Cambridge, with the college's world-renowned choir under its director Daniel Hyde. Members of the college read from the King James Bible and there is music by Bach, Mozart and Tchaikovsky

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott serves up a family-sized slab of chocolate recipes from the BBC archives, guaranteed to please the nation's chocoholics. The menu includes the Greedy Italians' classic chocolate pudding, the Hairy Bikers 'world's best' brownies, a chocolate mousse from Raymond Blanc, James Martin's marshmallows with chocolate dipping sauce and a surprise from Nigella Lawson - chocolate pasta

programme.title: Easter Parade (1948)
programme.desc: A dancer abandoned by his usual partner trains a chorus girl as a replacement. The new pairing is a great success but, although he strives to keep their relationship strictly professional, he begins to fall head over heels in love with her. Musical, with Fred Astaire, Judy Garland, Peter Lawford and Ann Miller. Songs include A Couple of Swells, Stepping Out with My Baby and Shaking the Blues Away

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: The story of the Hollywood musical, using interviews with stars from the genre's golden age, as well as some of the directors and songwriters who helped create them. Among the big names remembering their experiences are Fred Astaire, Gene Kelly, Julie Andrews, Rex Harrison, Barbra Streisand, Liza Minnelli and Judy Garland, while the films under discussion include Singin' in the Rain, On the Town, My Fair Lady, Funny Girl and The Sound of Music

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough has a passion for birds' eggs, which protect the young from the outside world at the same time as allowing them to breathe and are strong enough to withstand the full weight of an incubating parent and weak enough to allow a chick to break free. In this documentary, the broadcaster reveals the secrets of birds' eggs from creation to hatching, exploring how they are made, the reasons behind their shape and their intrinsic purpose

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team are at Normanby Hall in north Lincolnshire, where experts Michael Baggot and Caroline Hawley unearth some favourite antiques among the crowd, including a French poster. Plus, Paul uncovers how the building became a hospital during the First World War

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers each have two days, a painter, a carpenter and £1,000 to transform a 1930s beach chalet to fit their different briefs. Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta, but the stakes are raised as the team that reaches the checkpoint last is eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace finds out how Jaffa Cakes are made on a visit to the Manchester factory where McVitie's churn out 1.4 billion of them every year. He follows the process from the delivery of a pre-blended wheat delivery - a pre-blended secret ingredient that gives the cake their light texture - to mixing, baking, jam piping and the addition of the chocolate topping. Away from the factory, historian Ruth Goodman finds out about the historic legal case which saw the company defending their right to call the product a cake and not a biscuit

programme.title: The Boleyns: A Scandalous Family
programme.desc: The docudrama telling the story of the rise and fall of the Boleyn family during the reign of Henry VIII continues. Anne Boleyn returns to England from France having grown into a real beauty and she dazzles the Tudor Court while her family plays the long game to catch a king

programme.title: Commando: Britain's Ocean Warriors
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the Royal Marine Commandos, following the training and deployment of those who make up the fighting unit, and exploring its heritage, ethos, culture and role in the modern world. The first edition meets recruits Dom and Kane, who are attempting to earn the prestigious green beret and need to match the resilience and resolve of those who came before them if they're to follow in their footsteps

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: The comedian returns with her travelogue in which she tracks down the world's most endangered jobs and crafts. She begins in Greece, where she meets the last monk in a monastery, a family of church bell-makers, and villagers who communicate by whistling to one another

programme.title: Eternal Beauty (2019)
programme.desc: After being jilted at the altar, Jane falls into a state of despair and schizophrenia. However, her life starts to change when she begins a darkly comic romance with Mike, a failed musician and fellow lost soul. Romantic comedy drama, starring Sally Hawkins, David Thewlis and Billie Piper

programme.title: Gods of Snooker
programme.desc: The sport's rise to prominence, beginning with how Alex 'Hurricane' Higgins upset the snooker establishment to help transform a game played in the backrooms of working men's clubs into a TV ratings hit. Interest in the sport had been growing thanks to the new possibilities of colour broadcasting, and in particular the weekly snooker show Pot Black, but it was the antics of the unpredictable Ulstersman that took the game stratospheric

programme.title: Burt Bacharach at the BBC
programme.desc: When Burt Bacharach passed away in February at the age of 94, the world said goodbye to one of the all-time great songwriters and composers. This tribute features archive performances of songs from his extraordinary back catalogue by artists including Aretha Franklin, Adele, Dusty Springfield, Dionne Warwick, Cilla Black and the White Stripes

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sally meets writer and broadcaster Gyles Brandreth to discover how Easter has informed a life filled with love, faith, politics and pantomime. Gyles's story takes him from family Easter egg hunts and searching for the secrets of happiness through to the paradox of combining a love of frivolity and light entertainment with a political career. For once, Gyles is lost for words as he discusses his blessings on an emotional spring walk with the host

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife of Britain's woodlands through the seasons, including a look at how the reintroduction of wild boar to the Forest of Dean has helped robins to find food in winter. Other creatures featured include the world's largest land slug and starlings falling prey to owls on Bodmin Moor. Plus, a look at how a subterranean network of fungi connects the whole forest together

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some interest to the spring garden. He also sows peas and shallots, has some thrifty tips for petunias, and plants lilies in pots. Carol Klein visits Mothecombe Gardens in Devon, which has been designed specifically for pollinators. Arit Anderson joins a group of young carers at a community garden in West Sussex, where they go for respite, friendship and fun

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Jill presents an English mid-century teddy bear that she's had for 66 years, Andrew appears with an early 19th-century copper ale mull, Sa offers up a decorative clock, while Bill showcases an old printing block that he thinks has the 'wow' factor

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is on Gower, but instead of taking the route along Worms Head sets off along a less well-known stretch of coast from Fall Bay to Oxwich. The first half of the walk is along the headland so, to get a closer look at the cliffs, Derek joins a group abseiling into a blow hole and squeezing through a tunnel. Re-joining the pathway, Derek then learns about the area's history of smuggling and deliberate shipwrecking. After walking round the Oxwich headland, he arrives at pretty St Illytd's church. His walk ends on Oxwich beach, where he forages for seaweed with top chef Hywel Griffith

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: The Lavender Hill Mob (1951)
programme.desc: An unassuming bank worker masterminds a plot to steal £1million in gold bullion, then melts it down and turns it into statues of the Eiffel Tower that can easily be exported - but the plan soon goes awry, with hilarious results. Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Stanley Holloway, Sid James and Audrey Hepburn

programme.title: Passport to Pimlico (1949)
programme.desc: The residents of a London suburb discover documents proving their neighbourhood is not part of Britain, and declare independence. Appointing their own head of state, they begin erecting borders as the government resorts to desperate measures to bring the community back under British rule. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway and Margaret Rutherford

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers step back in time to the 1950s and '60s world of London's East End. The duo uncover murder and brutality when their tour takes them to pubs once central to the criminal deeds of the Kray twins. Si takes a drive-in with an old associate of the notorious siblings, while Dave learns how to 'fight the Kray way' at the Repton Boxing Club, where the deadly duo once trained

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: The team combines sustainability with staying on trend, with Kirsty Wilson demonstrating how to create a living herb wall made out of recycled materials

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Documentary following three of the world's largest rivers, beginning with the Amazon, uncovering some of the latest discoveries, including the 'Blue Lagoon' which is home to a newly discovered species of cichlid. The programme also explores some of the Amazon's flooded forests, home to an array of unusual animals, and cameras follow giant river otters on a fishing foray on the rocky terraces of the Cristalino river

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team head to Shropshire to help Bethan and John turn a 1940s railway goods carriage into a B&B located in their back garden

programme.title: Charlie Mackesy: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox, the Horse and Me
programme.desc: The author takes viewers on a journey through his formative years and later-life success, from his idyllic upbringing on a farm in rural England, to the streets of London. He traces the events that shaped his artistic imagination and reveals how his best-selling book The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse came to resonate with readers around the world. With insights from friends including writer and director Richard Curtis and explorer Bear Grylls

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin heads to historic places around the UK, including Capesthorne Hall in Cheshire, where Anita Manning has a surprise in store for one lucky woman. Paul also visits Chedworth Roman Villa in the Cotswolds

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Businesswoman and veteran Dragon Deborah Meaden is the first well-known face to check in to a Victorian villa nestled on the wild Northern Irish coast, where host Sharon ensures that all guests come away from the 19th-century B&B with new skills and a fresh perspective. Michelin-starred chef Alex Greene makes sure every meal is a truly memorable experience, while gardener Mary-Anne ensures the fresh produce adds local flavour to every dish

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenter Nick Knowles, comedian Sara Barron, musical theatre star Ore Oduba, and wine expert Helen McGinn, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Hungry Ghosts by Kevin Jared Hosein, and I'm Not Scared by Niccolo Ammaniti

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: The RNLI volunteers at Lough Ree Lifeboat Station race to the rescue of the last inhabitant of a remote island. On the north-east coast of England, the Blyth crew races to find a kayaker in trouble in the North Sea, while at Tower station in Central London, a dog is trapped by the tide on the River Thames

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the fifth semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of Fridtjof Nansen, the 4AD record label, Christina Rossetti, and the Jason Bourne films, before facing the general knowledge round

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-final stage continues, with two teams who have won a match returning to play again, looking for the second victory that will secure them a place in the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The NYPD investigates multiple leads regarding the murder of Nick De Noia, with possible motives including a love triangle, insurance fraud, or an angry boss - all of which lead nowhere. Years later, the FBI receives a tip from a hitman known as Strawberry, which blows the case wide open

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The FBI teams up with down-and-out actor Ray Colon, who leads federal agents on an international manhunt for the person behind Nick De Noia's murder. However, even after the mystery is solved and the killer is behind bars, the story is far from over, with a shocking death and the discovery of tens of millions of dollars secretly hidden in Switzerland

programme.title: The Graduate (1967)
programme.desc: A naive college graduate, hailed as a genius by his overbearing parents, is seduced by the middle-aged wife of his father's business partner - but later falls in love with her daughter. Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Dustin Hoffman, Anne Bancroft and Katharine Ross, with a soundtrack by Simon and Garfunkel

programme.title: Gods of Snooker
programme.desc: A look at the emergence of Steve Davis and the rise of promoter Barry Hearn's Matchroom group of players, which brought lucrative sponsorships into the game. By the mid-1980s, snooker was at the peak of its popularity and in 1985 nearly 20 million people tuned in to see Steve Davis play Dennis Taylor in the World Championship final

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor and Joe Crowley are in Sherwood Forest to unravel some hidden histories of this nature reserve and site of special scientific interest. Margherita finds out the role Sherwood played as a training ground in the First World War, while Joe discovers why Sherwood has a missing generation of oaks and how premature ageing is helping to fill the gap. Plus, why the new deal for Northern Ireland hasn't included veterinary medicine, with potentially devastating consequences

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs pitch their money-making ideas to a panel of self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A surgeon-turned-inventor thinks he's solved a universal problem for parents, while low strength gin gets tastebuds tingling. A Norwich-based couple pitch their children's storage baskets with a twist, and an entrepreneur is on a mission to eliminate the dreaded sweat patch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Recently diagnosed with autism and dyslexia Shannon has only ever given the hand turned bowls she makes on her incredible foot-powered pole lathe as presents. Dom Chinea and mentor Alice love her work and the way she produces it and want to convince Shannon that she and the bowls she creates are much more marketable than she thinks. Successful musician Ryan wants to quit touring to spend more time at home with his young family and hopes an upcycling business will make that possible. Mentor Zoe can see his work is high quality, but is worried his style doesn't stand out from the crowd

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts the show from Eccleston, Lancashire, and visits Astley Hall in Chorley to learn about some intriguing furniture. With experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a pottery wheel, a transforming tea stand and a set of port hole mirrors

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores Abergavenny food festival in Wales, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Cargo in a British port grinds to a halt when a tugboat picks up a mystery object in its propeller. The divers respond to a callout to get the tug moving again, and end up using everything at their disposal - even a kitchen knife - in an attempt to free the propeller from whatever has been dumped in the river

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the Easter fixtures, including Hull FC v Hull Kingston Rovers, Wigan Warriors v St Helens and Leeds Rhinos v Huddersfield Giants

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers visit Edinburgh, where they learn about 19th-century serial murderers William Burke and William Hare. The duo also discover dark histories in pubs that witnessed murder, crime and gruesome punishments in the 1800s, hear about a ghost who haunts one of the city's oldest bars. They also meet a pub folk singer who keeps the Scottish capital's historic tales alive in his songs

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Following the astonishing wildlife, landscapes and people of the world's longest river, the Nile, beginning in the tropical mountain range of the Rwenzoris, home to one of the world's strangest birds, the shoebill stork. Then, cameras follow the Nile's journey as it travels through the wild Savannah lands of Uganda, before reaching the Ethiopian highlands where it receives an injection of water far to the East

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team create an unusual B&B in Devon for Michele and Tobin, who want to turn their tired summerhouse into a property that could accommodate four-legged guests

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison create virtual reality renovations for a three-bed home in Surrey, which has a poorly positioned front door and a cluttered hallway. The owners are divided over whether an extension would solve their problems, and the architects present them with two very different visions for what their home could be. Laura takes a characteristically pragmatic approach with a simple but striking contemporary design. But experimental architect Robert decides a far more radical approach is the only answer

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin visits the picturesque Cotswolds village of Broadway to uncover its artistic past. He also revisits some of the historic venues from the series, with new valuations and unexpected auctions

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared each Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Si King of the Hairy Bikers checks in and is keen to help in the kitchen, but Sharon first organises for him to visit the Lacada Brewery - a community-led project that has mastered the art of the perfect brew. Armed with the local, flavourful tipple, Si assists chef Alex in the kitchen creating a seafood feast to celebrate the bountiful catch from Northern Ireland's coast

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Members of the public nominate local heroes from across Yorkshire to receive a bespoke, hand-made piece of wooden furniture to recognise the work they do for their communities. Sisters Becky and Shelley, who work for a homeless charity in Leeds, receive a bespoke piece of wooden furniture, and sheep farmer David from the Yorkshire Dales nominates fellow farmer Sam, who went out of his way to help him in his hour of need

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: The hunt for a missing person in the vast rural area around Golspie sees search dog handler PC Adam Naismith and German shepherd Wolf deployed, bu the case takes a turn when police discover he is wanted for questioning by another force. Inverness CID carry out a major operation against county lines drug dealers. On Skye, Sgt Gordon McKay comes to the aid of a stranded tourist with a nasty hillwalking injury

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Gordon's day goes from bad to worse when he is distracted by the impulsive actions of an attractive stranger, Ashley, and accidentally hits a stray dog with his car. Australian comedy about two singletons who proceed to navigate the complexities of life together. Written by and starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Gods of Snooker
programme.desc: Desperate for success and tempted by the lucrative rewards brought by towing the line, Jimmy White joined Barry Hearn in the hope he could be turned into a champion like his new stablemate Steve Davis. With White as the hot favourite and with the crowd urging him on against 21-year-old Stephen Hendry, the final of 1990 world championship turned out to be a pivotal moment in British snooker and paved the way for what was to come in the next decade

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Seven well known personalities with differing faiths and beliefs, meet in northern Portugal to tackle a modern-day Catholic pilgrimage. Taking part are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight

programme.title: The MI5 Spy and the IRA: Operation Chiffon
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Peter Taylor reveals the extraordinary story of how a former undercover MI5 officer put his life and career on the line to encourage the IRA to end its violent campaign and embrace politics. The former MI5 officer, simply known as Robert, ran the top-secret back channel of communications between the UK government and the leadership of the IRA. What Robert did has been a closely guarded secret for three decades and was the key link in the chain that led to the Good Friday Agreement

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. She tries a marriage introduction day at a mosque, a Muslim-only dating app and a live dating event with a difference. Will she find love? And will her mother approve?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara

programme.title: Tenebrae: Bach to MacMillan
programme.desc: The award-winning Tenebrae Choir contrast Bach's iconic motets with the sacred music of James MacMillan in a special programme for Easter from St John's Smith Square, London. The motets are renowned for their technical difficulty, requiring minute attention to detail as well as a full emotional range. Here, Tenebrae perform the three most well known of the set, culminating in the joyful Singet dem Herrn. That's followed by MacMillan's I Saw Eternity, a setting of words by Henry Vaughan

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: A selection of performances of the music of Bach from the BBC archives featuring soloists including David Oistrakh, Yo-Yo Ma, Andras Schiff and Myra Hess

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob follows artist Sonia Boyce as she represents Great Britain at the 2022 Venice Biennale, making her the first black woman to hold this prestigious role. Cameras follows the installation of her pavilion, which draws on the lives of black women in the British music industry. The programme looks back on her career, which has encompassed pastel self-portraits, interactive ice sculptures and performance art created through improvisation

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Michael reflects on his fourth travel series, exploring the Sahara. This journey brought him into contact with nomads, refugees and artists who had sought out this vast desert, but also those displaced by war, the migrant crisis and the rise of militant Islam. The journey took Michael over the Atlas Mountains, to a Smara refugee camp, to the famed city of Timbuktu, and into the deep desert as part of a camel train

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Thailand, finding out about the lifesaving work of Bangkok's Queen Saovabha Memorial Institute and ending in the resort of Hua Hin

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits the north of Britain to look at the most fascinating archaeology uncovered in the region over the course of 2021. In North Yorkshire, a team of community volunteers are digging down beneath Richmond Castle. On the northern tip of the Orkney Islands, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists racing to unearth rare discoveries from an endangered Neolithic tomb before it erodes into the sea. And 10 miles east of Edinburgh, volunteers are hunting for evidence of Scotland's oldest railway

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock presents the latest science in the hunt for exterrestrial life, visiting Professor Mark Sephton at Imperial College London - one of the scientists leading on the Perseverance Rover mission to Mars. Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: An IRA mortar attack on 10 Downing Street in 1991, just months after John Major had taken office, apparently strengthened the British government's refusal to talk to terrorists. However, unbeknown to the public, a secret channel of communication was opened between the Irish republican movement and Her Majesty's Government. The former prime minister recalls this and the highly charged meetings that led to the Downing Street Declaration of December 1993

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: The house nears completion but Griff Rhys Jones faces some important decisions and last-minute disasters as he prepares to host a celebratory party - unsure of whether the construction will be finished by the time his guests arrive

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The vitamin industry is worth more than £400million a year in the UK alone, but what are these pills actually doing for people's health? Dr Giles Yeo aims to find out, exploring if vitamin and mineral supplements are what they appear to be and putting people's diets to the test to find out if they really need these supplements. Those he meets include a scientist in Copenhagen, whose groundbreaking research into antioxidants indicates they may not have the extraordinary health-enhancing properties that people believe, and a nutrition scientist from the University of Greenwich, who tells Giles that on average most people in the UK are meeting their vitamin requirements thorough their diet

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry arrives home to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: The documentary considers how people's understanding of nature is increasing in order to manage global warming, which is changing the planet faster than ever before

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Having restored the main farmhouse, Griff Rhys Jones embarks on the second phase of his Pembrokeshire project, turning his attention to the watermill and the derelict miller's cottage. With his son George, who is training to be an architect, overseeing the design, Griff plans to convert both these outbuildings into accommodation

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun persuades Bitzer to take part in his game of cricket, but the resident moles are unhappy about it taking place above their heads and a full scale war ensues

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.desc: Boy Quits Bobbleheads. Suddenly feeling too old to be collecting toys, Boy gives up his bobbleheads!

programme.desc: A brave little girl orders a shield to protect her from a monster and sets off with the Ninjas, her scaredy-cat dad, a goblin, a troll and a dragon to find her missing aunt.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Jamie Jam and Marty Marmalade are always stopped by Odd Squad! Determined to help other villains avoid getting caught, they team up to trade tips.

programme.title: Oswaldo
programme.desc: Leia discovers campaigning is hard work when she runs against Tobias for class president.

programme.title: The Farmer's Llamas
programme.desc: When the Farmer and Bitzer go to a country fair, Shaun the Sheep steals away with them intent on causing mischief. He spies an auction where he sees three exotic and very crafty llamas going under the hammer. Instantly impressed by their amusing pranks, Shaun sneakily gets the Farmer to buy them, but it's not long before these cheeky newcomers wreak havoc. Animated fun, with the voice of Justin Fletcher

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Kelvin Fletcher joins the team in the garden and Mwaksy meets viewers who love gardening with their grandparents

programme.title: Love! Love! Love!
programme.desc: Max and Harvey find out why adventure parks are trending as they go head-to-head in a series of challenges. Seyi Andes-Pelumi, from CBBC's Lagging, creates an epic playlist, and Arthur is checking the weather for this week's Video Hero.

programme.title: Dodger
programme.desc: When a heist goes wrong, Dodger is given his harshest punishment yet - school! Sent to the upper crust St Albion's College, he must unravel the mystery of a secret society.

programme.title: Gangsta Granny Strikes Again!
programme.desc: Family comedy sequel, based on the children's book by David Walliams. Schoolboy Ben is getting to life without his beloved Gran, and although it's a year since she died, the memories of their Crown Jewel heist are fresh in his mind. But then he hears about another spate of burglaries, with all clues pointing to the Black Cat - better known as Granny. How could the shady senior citizen be back to her old tricks from beyond the grave? Archie Yates stars as Ben, with Walliams and Sheridan Smith as his mum and dad, alongside Griff Rhys Jones, Maggie Steed and Kevin Bishop

programme.title: Nine Minute Ninja
programme.desc: Series in which Ricky makes art in nine minutes. Ricky proves that you can make art from anything as he accidently creates a fashion look that quickly goes viral, as well as some punk patches that will perk up a backpack.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Joe and Meryl are joined by the Dengineers Designers to give a masterclass on creating your own dream space.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Gruesome tales from the past, featuring the Spartan High School Musical, a group of cavemen trying to stay fit, a jester giving bad news to Henry VIII and Roman emperor Nero starring in a movie

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Britain's greatest sailor suffers from seasickness, and two doctors from the Middle Ages argue over how to treat a patient

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Professor Squawkencluck's body swap with King Kong Brunel has dire consequences

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: The heroic rodent leads the Danger Babies astray

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM teams up with Jeopardy Mouse crash-land on a desolate planet in space. The pair's inability to work together without bickering places them in great danger

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.desc: Walter's pampered cat Clawdia persuades her way into the gang, and only Gnasher can tell that she has a hidden agenda to oust him from Dennis's life for ever

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dr Pfooflepfeffer's first act as head of governors is to turn Bash Street School into a boarding school, but the pupils devise a series of daring attempts to escape

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Miss Mistry offers thumb wrestling as a solution to resolve Dennis and Walter's spiralling competitiveness

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis is accidentally elected class president and is eager to shed the burden that comes with the title

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: The ninjas battle a hungry space blob as they try to fulfill an order for a flag for astronaut Lewis Weaklegs to plant on the Moon

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: When an exhausted mother orders a replacement for her daughter's lost cuddly toy, the Ninjas must travel to a seaside fairground and stand up to some delinquent dolphins

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: Desperate to prove he is still needed, Mega Powerful Man asks the ninjas to find him a worthy villain to battle against

programme.title: Bro's in Control
programme.desc: Joe and Adam take on a rip-roaring rodeo challenge. Can they gain their cowboy credentials and lasso like a pro, or will they fall off their high horse?

programme.title: Meet the McQueens
programme.desc: How can Omari and his brothers help Kiara overcome her nervousness about going to her first ever gym class? Or has Kiara got it under control?

programme.title: Meet the McQueens
programme.desc: Omari has set his heart on opening up a test kitchen, but can he and his family decorate the venue, order supplies, plan the menu and launch a publicity campaign in just one week?

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Coasts
programme.desc: It's literally a packed show as the OZT HQ is crammed full of some of the fastest-swimming marine life and deepest divers surrounding Britain's shores. Tyler takes the plunge in Plymouth to reveal how a special marine plant is being brought back from the edge of extinction to help fight climate change. Plucking up courage, he then dives deep to swim with sharks and is amazed by what he discovers about this incredible but sometimes misunderstood species. Just off Britain's north east coast, Cam also slips into his wetsuit to go snorkelling with seal whisperer Ben. Getting up close with some inquisitive seals, he learns of the threats they face from plastic pollution. It's all eyes on the Scottish skies as the OZT brothers go on a mission to the Isle of Mull to look for the ultimate soaring sea bird, the white-tailed eagle - but who will spot one first, and can Cam get the perfect picture? Back at OZT HQ, Aaron's animal knowledge gets put to the test with some quickfire questions from th

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: An abandoned cabin isn't quite what it seems for Bea and Louis, while Meg and Glen discover a new quality to the alien rock in the ground

programme.title: Dodger
programme.desc: When a heist goes wrong, Dodger is given his harshest punishment yet - school! Sent to the upper crust St Albion's College, he must unravel the mystery of a secret society.

programme.title: Lagging
programme.desc: SMoRCLe goes global as the team search Zaag for a legendary Korean player. Instead they find puppets, rabbits, robots, spiders, sand worms and some very familiar faces.

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Team Mahaki challenge Team Volkov to a step challenge.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: A jealous Gwen is determined to find out more about Darrell's past at St Hilda's and leaves the school in pursuit of the truth

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer injures his back during a game of golf, so Shaun borrows the clubs and learns how to play. Meanwhile, Bitzer is forced to look after his injured master

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The after-school art club is under threat of demolition. In trying to save it, the gang ends up on the trail of the mysterious undercover urban artist known only as Pranksy

programme.desc: The gang want to win theme park tickets that are up for grabs in a robot fighting contest. They ask to use Mouse's unbeatable robot, but he prefers to help them build their own.
