programme.title: Easter Sunday Worship
programme.desc: A traditional celebration for Easter, live from Southwell Minster in Nottinghamshire, led by the Dean, the Very Rev Nicola Sullivan. The preacher is the bishop of Southwell and Nottingham, the Rt Rev Paul Williams. With seasonal hymns and choral music, including Jesus Christ Is Risen Today and Thine Be the Glory, sung by the Cathedral Choir and congregation, directed by Jonathan Allsopp

programme.title: Urbi et Orbi
programme.desc: On the 10th Easter of his pontificate, Pope Francis gives his Easter message and blessing, Urbi et Orbi - to the city and to the world. Petroc Trelawny sets the scene

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Sally Philips meets the Rt Rev Rose Hudson-Wilkin to discuss what Easter means to her and how she has spent her life fighting for acceptance and change within the church

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores Monmouthshire, looks for a rare bee on the Gwent Levels and finds fallow deer in the Wye Valley, as well as a heavily camouflaged bird near Abergavenny. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins celebrates Easter Sunday from Chester Cathedral, and meets the team working on the Chester Mystery Plays. Laura Wright hears about Handel's visit to the city

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Alex Jones gives people a chance to be reunited with someone pivotal from their past, beginning with 21-year-old Tegan, whose life was saved by a stranger after she fell onto a Tube track. Cameras also follow Lee, who hopes to meet his brother for the first time, and Pippa, a youngster who wants to thank volunteers for a life-changing home improvement which helped ease her rare skin condition

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Europe's most productive leech farm in Hendy, South Wales, to learn why the creatures are making a medicinal comeback. In Swansea, Sean discovers how maggots are working their magic for a patient recovering from a major infection. Plus, medical-themed stories from the archives

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Brodie Castle in Scotland, and meets a family of bagpipe makers. Treasures include a cane with a concealed compass and telescope, an engraved silver salver awarded to a local engineer, a pair of rare 18th-century silk shoes, and a watch that saved someone's life. Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Jaggers makes Pip an offer of a new life in London - but he soon comes to realise the horrific cost that must be paid for his rise in society. As his education begins, he discovers that Estella is due to be married - a revelation that Jaggers hopes to use to his advantage. Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
programme.desc: An android-hunter working for the Los Angeles Police Department discovers a long-buried secret, which leads him to track down former detective Rick Deckard, who's been missing for 30 years and is linked to the case. Denis Villeneuve's sci-fi thriller, the sequel to Ridley Scott's 1982 classic, starring Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford, Ana de Armas and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and her mum argue as they get to grips with the diagnosis but all is forgiven when they go wig shopping in London after Letitia's first treatment. At Crosby Manor, the builders are in to start planning the new nursery and Charlotte faces the fact her mum might not be at the birth

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester United v Everton at Old Trafford and Southampton v Manchester City at Saint Mary's Stadium. Both Manchester clubs were looking for three points against teams battling to avoid relegation. Plus, Aston Villa v Nottingham Forest, Brentford v Newcastle United, Fulham v West Ham United, Leicester City v Bournemouth, Tottenham Hotspur v Brighton & Hove Albion and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Chelsea

programme.title: Easter Sunday Worship
programme.desc: A traditional celebration for Easter, live from Southwell Minster in Nottinghamshire, led by the Dean, the Very Rev Nicola Sullivan. The preacher is the bishop of Southwell and Nottingham, the Rt Rev Paul Williams. With seasonal hymns and choral music, including Jesus Christ Is Risen Today and Thine Be the Glory, sung by the Cathedral Choir and congregation, directed by Jonathan Allsopp

programme.title: Urbi et Orbi
programme.desc: On the 10th Easter of his pontificate, Pope Francis gives his Easter message and blessing, Urbi et Orbi - to the city and to the world. Petroc Trelawny sets the scene

programme.title: Reflections at the Quay
programme.desc: Words and music for Easter, with Celtic Worship in Glasgow, Joshua Aina in Aberdeen, and National Youth Choirs of Scotland, Unoma Okudo and the Choir of St Mary's Cathedral in Edinburgh. Colin Dow of Glasgow City Free Church, Diana Hall from St Anne's Dunbar, former Church of Scotland moderator Lorna Hood, and William Nolan, Archbishop of Glasgow, choose their favourite parts of the Easter story

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp leads the way around Nottingham racecourse. Experts David Harper and Danny Sebastian lend a hand to the teams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Sally Philips meets the Rt Rev Rose Hudson-Wilkin to discuss what Easter means to her and how she has spent her life fighting for acceptance and change within the church

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins celebrates Easter Sunday from Chester Cathedral, and meets the team working on the Chester Mystery Plays. Laura Wright hears about Handel's visit to the city

programme.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Europe's most productive leech farm in Hendy, South Wales, to learn why the creatures are making a medicinal comeback. In Swansea, Sean discovers how maggots are working their magic for a patient recovering from a major infection. Plus, medical-themed stories from the archives

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Brodie Castle in Scotland, and meets a family of bagpipe makers. Treasures include a cane with a concealed compass and telescope, an engraved silver salver awarded to a local engineer, a pair of rare 18th-century silk shoes, and a watch that saved someone's life. Plus, the story of a sheep that changed science's understanding of genetics

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Jaggers makes Pip an offer of a new life in London - but he soon comes to realise the horrific cost that must be paid for his rise in society. As his education begins, he discovers that Estella is due to be married - a revelation that Jaggers hopes to use to his advantage. Magwitch and Compeyson resume their struggle in the Australian penal colony, and both are left grievously wounded in the encounter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield and Leeds United v Crystal Palace at Elland Road. The Gunners prevailed 3-2 against Liverpool at Emirates Stadium in October, but Jurgen Klopp's men had already defeated Manchester City and Manchester United here in the league this term, despite their struggles for consistent form. Palace claimed a 2-1 win over Leeds at Selhurst Park, but much has changed at the two clubs in the six months since, with Roy Hodgson and Javi Gracia now the respective managers. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from Dundee United v Hibernian at Tannadice. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
programme.desc: An android-hunter working for the Los Angeles Police Department discovers a long-buried secret, which leads him to track down former detective Rick Deckard, who's been missing for 30 years and is linked to the case. Denis Villeneuve's sci-fi thriller, the sequel to Ridley Scott's 1982 classic, starring Ryan Gosling, Harrison Ford, Ana de Armas and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gaby Roslin and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A claw hammer containing the killer and victim's DNA is the key to cracking a murder. Plus, a burglar who photographs himself in the act leads police straight to his door

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A hand-reared aardvark is reunited with her family for the first time since birth, but keepers are not sure whether she will be welcomed or perceived as a threat

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts heads to Suffolk, where he finds himself charmed by a two-bed mid-terrace that has remained largely untouched over the years. He is less enthusiastic about a two-bed semi in Bedfordshire, however, in which he discovers several worrying cracks in the walls. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin is off barnstorming in Kent to look at the development potential of an enormous plot of land

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a firm that makes wooden standing frames for people with spinal injuries. With Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: The fraudsters taking out expensive phone contracts and leaving others to foot the bill, and how Companies House is being abused by criminals - to legitimise their wrongdoing leaving innocent people to deal with the fallout. And there's plenty more advice and tips along the way. Presented by Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A mother and daughter in Surrey call on the help of interior designer Kunal Trehan and the virtual reality design studio for advice on what to do with their dark and dingy hallway

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is in the Welsh Marches with a couple who want to find a new home with enough land to be self-sufficient. They also visit a community gardening project

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a pottery wheel, a transforming tea stand and a set of port hole mirrors

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the North Esk south of Edinburgh from the Pentland Hills. He reaches Roslin Glen, which inspired some of Scotland's greatest artists and writers - especially the mysterious Rosslyn Chapel on the cliffs above. The power of the river was later harnessed for papermaking. Paul discovers the legacy of industry before heading to ancient Musselburgh on the coast near Edinburgh

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat. Presented by Alex Jones and Emma Willis

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lily is nervous ahead of her 20 week scan and Ricky is panicking about being a dad. Kim begs Howie for forgiveness but he won't listen. Suki and Eve return from their business trip and Vinny gets Eve involved in planning a surprise party for Nish

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the audition round of this year's cookery competition. The nine contestants must each prepare a Family Favourite dish, which John and Gregg will sample in a special tasting room - with no clue which cook prepared which meal. After they have chosen their three favourites to fast-track to the next round, the remaining contestants will be set an invention test

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace Ellis investigates the punishment shooting of a young McIntyre drug runner, and her old skills as a social worker help get the evidence she needs to bring charges against the gang. However, she is stalled by a senior colleague, who makes it clear that she should back off. When Gordy pulls away from Angela, she becomes desperate for help

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Facelift
programme.desc: Builders begin construction of the new hospital, with Darren McKeown and Tom Cronin working with architect Ruari Gardiner to get the design just right. At the clinic, Dr Russell Bramhall performs a facelift, while Darren and Tom prepare for the arrival of their baby ahead of jetting off to Palm Springs

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The judges test the contestants' commercial potential in song production, with the six singers paired up and challenged to rework and remix their partner's signature track. Once they've finished in the studio, they will then have to showcase their reworked song live in front of their rivals and the judges, before one pair are challenged to perform against each other to stay in the contest

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble

programme.title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Charlie Mackesy's popular illustrated book about a boy and his animal companions, who share a series of brief but profound conversations on the nature of friendship as they journey together in the youngster's search for home. With the voices of Tom Hollander, Idris Elba, Gabriel Byrne and newcomer Jude Coward Nicoll

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat. Presented by Alex Jones and Emma Willis

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lily is nervous ahead of her 20 week scan and Ricky is panicking about being a dad. Kim begs Howie for forgiveness but he won't listen. Suki and Eve return from their business trip and Vinny gets Eve involved in planning a surprise party for Nish

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the audition round of this year's cookery competition. The nine contestants must each prepare a Family Favourite dish, which John and Gregg will sample in a special tasting room - with no clue which cook prepared which meal. After they have chosen their three favourites to fast-track to the next round, the remaining contestants will be set an invention test

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace Ellis investigates the punishment shooting of a young McIntyre drug runner, and her old skills as a social worker help get the evidence she needs to bring charges against the gang. However, she is stalled by a senior colleague, who makes it clear that she should back off. When Gordy pulls away from Angela, she becomes desperate for help

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Murder in Paradise
programme.desc: Darragh MacIntyre and Allison Morris explore the case of Michaela McAreavey, who was found strangled in the bathtub of her honeymoon suite in Mauritius in 2011. Michaela's widower, John McAreavey, recounts how he discovered his wife's body, and his subsequent ordeal as the first suspect, while the Detective Inspector who led the investigation explains how police arrested three hotel workers within 24 hours, with evidence pointing to a robbery gone wrong

programme.title: The Secret Peacemaker
programme.desc: Documentary about Father Alec Reid, who hit the headlines in 1988 after reading the last rites to two British Army corporals fatally injured after they drove into an IRA funeral in west Belfast. He also worked as a secret facilitator between Gerry Adams, John Hume and the Irish government in talks to bring peace to Northern Ireland, which ultimately led to the Good Friday Agreement in 1998

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The judges test the contestants' commercial potential in song production, with the six singers paired up and challenged to rework and remix their partner's signature track. Once they've finished in the studio, they will then have to showcase their reworked song live in front of their rivals and the judges, before one pair are challenged to perform against each other to stay in the contest

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: DNA on a shoelace links a man to a series of violent attacks at music venues. Plus, police crack a case by finding coded information in a spreadsheet that leads to a hacker

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The threat of a deadly disease forces the keepers to take action when the ankole cattle have to be screened for TB, a dangerous challenge for the biosecurity team and the keepers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned in Wakefield, West Yorkshire; Bintree, Norfolk and Folkestone, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Ochuko Ojiri lead two teams competing at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, as they hunt for potentially profitable items to take to auction. Presenter Christina Trevanion monitors their progress and also looks at the art and history of Persian carpets

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville will be investigating the very latest scams doing the rounds, and taking some of the biggest names out there to task. Plus, top tips and advice on everything from getting companies to take complaints seriously to make sure customers' money is protected

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple in Newcastle call on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead for advice on how to bring some style and character to their bedroom

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a buyer find a new lease on life in the countryside. Now her sons have fledged the nest, today's buyer has her sights on Devon or Dorset

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers bring their items to the Bidding Room. Sophie brings in a rugby shirt from the film Chariots of Fire and James hopes to sell a truck door. Next up, John and Nicky present a coin operated ride on train and car to the dealers and George brings in a 20th century card table with a secret drawer. Plus, Barry comes in with some stained-glass panels

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ed Gamble on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Emma Willis present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve gives Suki the cold shoulder and has had enough with hiding. Stacey panics over her money troubles while the Slaters and Branning's gather for Lily's gender reveal party. Ravi is in big trouble with Nugget

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: In the quarter-final of the competition the designers are split into teams of two to makeover two wooden lodges used as wedding accommodation on the banks of Rutland Water in the East Midlands. With one team working on the bridal lodge and the other on the groom's room they have £3,000, an army of tradespeople and just two days to create a winning design that will impress Michelle and guest judge Shayne Brady and secure them a place in the semi-final

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The cooks are asked to create a dish inspired by their favourite celebrity chef. The pressure is on as only the best will remain and get to fight for a place in this week's quarter final. With just four places up for grabs, the remaining chefs have to cook a dish with layers to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Belfast's fastest growing beauty brand, where the motto is 'work hard, play hard'. The team prepare for a collaboration with Love Island winner Ekin-Su. Product designer Alex is feeling the pressure as she has to create a whole new palette and foundation range that Ekin-Su has to love. Everyone in the office is talking about Emma's new boyfriend but she's keeping him to herself for now and staying busy organising promotions on Ireland's most watched chat show

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Brendan has finally been able to fulfil a lifelong dream - to open his own make-up store in Ibiza. Social media whizz Ciara, is flying back from a launch in Toronto for a photoshoot with actress Jac Jossa on the island but things go south when Jac is in a car crash. Four hours before opening, the store is a mess and it's all hands on deck to prepare

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: A journalist offers Costello an exciting opportunity while she works at the peep show and she throws herself into the challenge while trying to keep her and Iris afloat. Gloria forms an unlikely connection at work, derailing her good behaviour and Selby reconnects with some old friends

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and Jake organise the biggest gender reveal party the north-east has ever seen but nerves set in as Charlotte is behind schedule leaving Jake alone to entertain the guests. As Letitia's shock diagnosis starts to sink in, Charlotte and her mum have an emotional heart to heart

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and her mum argue as they get to grips with the diagnosis but all is forgiven when they go wig shopping in London after Letitia's first treatment. At Crosby Manor, the builders are in to start planning the new nursery and Charlotte faces the fact her mum might not be at the birth

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Media Show
programme.desc: We explore China's campaign to influence the global narrative about the country across traditional and social media.

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. programme.title: Fraochy Bay

programme.title: Dystonia: Beatha air Fhiaradh
programme.desc: For almost 40 years, DK MacPhee has lived with dystonia, which leaves him unable to straighten his head. DK gives an insight into the impact this has on his daily life and his ongoing battle to find treatment or relief. As his condition has deteriorated, with his head falling further to one side, the more his life has been affected. A number of years ago, he had to give up playing football, weekly, with his friends, something which he very much misses and he is determined to try and play again. Will this be possible?

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Fredrik Nyman has to come up with a plan to save the factory, while Anna Hellevik sees an opportunity to help her father-in-law and starts scheming behind his back. Toril Torstensen gets help from an unexpected friend. In Norwegian and English

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to educate PB about the danger of spiders by luring one out with a decoy fly - his clumsy attempts attract a curious spider called Julie, who PB immediately wants to befriend. Can Lloyd accept that some spiders may not be all that bad?

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A scientist accidentally locks himself inside a sophisticated anti-matter vault, and only thief-turned-chauffeur Parker has the skillset required to get the man out. With the voices of series veteran David Graham

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean digs up Bruiser Snr's medallion and rushes off to the local museum convinced he's found treasure.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: It's Easter, and Mike organises a super special Easter egg hunt for Iris but the raccoons can't resist crashing the party

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to trap Mr Magoo - while Weasel captures Mr Cat and sends him to a far-off destination, Fizz demands a ransom from Mr Magoo and sends him an anonymous letter with a meeting point. However, Mr Magoo mistakes the letter for a treasure map...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo, who is on the roof of a building, believes he's by the sea - when he dives in to save a drowning swimmer (in reality, a statue in a traffic circle) he is struck by Fizz's laser and then becomes weightless.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo replaces his friend Serge for the day as a personal trainer - while he thinks he's giving a swimming lesson at the pool, he appears at Weasel's house at the worst moment: for the first time in his life, Fizz is out of ideas...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Having written a book on the subject, Gena agrees to train Lloyd in how to survive outdoors, but Lloyd is disappointed to discover that all the training is to take place indoors.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Abacus is targeted by The Louse Hunter, a ruthless louse spider who loves the thrill of the hunt, Lloyd steps up to the challenge of protecting his best friend. On this occasion, however, Abacus may not need his help...

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: Comedy arts and crafts show presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bursting with unique makes, top tips and inspirational art ideas, Bec experiments with recycled materials and uses her funny bones to make us laugh along the way. Bec has been asked by her neighbour to look after a pet called Fluffy. Plus, a customer calls to ask for an arty delivery to help keep her dog toys organised.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to actress Judy Parfitt and actors Larry Lamb and Adam Garcia, while former jockey Bob Champion introduces him to some Shetland ponies, and Andy Clarke pairs artisan chocolates with the best of British alcohol

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by TV and radio presenter Gloria Hunniford and demonstrates recipes for carrot cake, creme caramel and spatchcock chicken. There are also dishes from chefs Pip Lacey and Nieves Barragan and chocolatier Mark Tilling shares some of his creations

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team of horticultural experts come to the aid of Carol Nwosu, whose 16-year-old son has sickle cell anaemia. As well as caring for Danny, Carol runs a charity supporting families with children who also have the blood disorder, while battling crippling arthritis herself. Alan's plan is to make the Nwosus' tiny south London plot seem larger and provide them with a space that addresses all their needs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Champions Cup Rugby
programme.desc: Stade Rochelais v Saracens (Kick-off 3.00pm). Coverage of the quarter-final at Stade Marcel Deflandre, as Saracens take on the reigning champions. The French outfit progressed at this stage by the narrowest of margins last year, defeating Munster in a place-kick competition after a 24-24 draw at Aviva Stadium. With commentary by Miles Harrison

programme.title: Celebrity Lingo
programme.desc: RuPaul hosts as singer Lulu and TV presenter Lee Juggurnauth, star couple Stacey Dooley and Kevin Clifton, and A Question of Sport captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek try to use their powers of deduction to fill in the blanks and find the missing words in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The celebrity pairs will be playing for big money for their chosen charities up against the clock and their opponents

programme.title: For the Love of Paul O'Grady
programme.desc: A tribute to the late presenter, comedian and chat-show host, whose unexpected death at the age of 67 prompted a flood of tributes from viewers, his entertainment colleagues and even Camilla, Queen Consort. This special celebratory film features highlights from his incredible career and interviews with those who knew him best.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Why Didn't They Ask Evans?
programme.desc: Along the rugged Welsh coastline, vicar's son Bobby Jones finds a stricken man at the bottom of the cliffs who utters a mysterious question before dying. These enigmatic final words send Bobby and his socialite friend Lady Frankie Derwent on a crime-solving adventure. Hugh Laurie directs his own adaptation of the mystery, starring Will Poulter and Lucy Boynton

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious (2003)
programme.desc: A disgraced former cop is arrested by the FBI for illegal street racing, but his one-time colleagues offer him freedom in exchange for going on an undercover mission. Teaming up with an old racing friend and a customs official, he has to infiltrate and bring down a drug-trafficking operation. Thriller sequel, with Paul Walker reprising his role from The Fast and the Furious alongside Tyrese Gibson, Eva Mendes and Cole Hauser

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team are in the Wirral to create a jungle inspired outdoor space for Conrad and Pauline Toohey, who have dedicated their lives to helping others, including severely disabled son Keiron. Their garden is so overgrown some of the family have not used it for decades, so Alan and the team transform the garden into a tranquil retreat with a pond to attract wildlife, and covered pergola surrounded by tropical planting. Meanwhile, Frances Tophill is in Cornwall to visit the UK's only outdoor jungle at the Lost Gardens of Heligan, where she helps head gardener Cindy plant some pond lilies

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Sisters Sutandra and Sagarika from London, keen quizzers David and Tommy, a father and son from Carrickfergus in Northern Ireland, and Shropshire couple Joe and Kelly use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: An old case puts a stop to Dean's work plans and awakens insecurities for Manning, causing him to have second thoughts about his future in the force. Starring Marsha Thomason and Christopher Coghill

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo welcomes the Davies family from The Wirral, who take on the Russell family from Oxford. Both teams hope they have what it takes to win a £30,000 jackpot prize in the survey-based quiz

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by Great British Bake Off judge Prue Leith and actress Jessica Ransom. He also enjoys the company of 10 piglets, samples some afternoon tea inspired cocktails, and meets a sculptor who made a bust of Elizabeth II

programme.title: Dare Master @Home
programme.desc: A mega hopscotch course and a unique clothes competition are just two of the challenges facing Danny and his competitors

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to educate PB about the danger of spiders by luring one out with a decoy fly - his clumsy attempts attract a curious spider called Julie, who PB immediately wants to befriend. Can Lloyd accept that some spiders may not be all that bad?

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A scientist accidentally locks himself inside a sophisticated anti-matter vault, and only thief-turned-chauffeur Parker has the skillset required to get the man out. With the voices of series veteran David Graham

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean digs up Bruiser Snr's medallion and rushes off to the local museum convinced he's found treasure.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: It's Easter, and Mike organises a super special Easter egg hunt for Iris but the raccoons can't resist crashing the party

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to trap Mr Magoo - while Weasel captures Mr Cat and sends him to a far-off destination, Fizz demands a ransom from Mr Magoo and sends him an anonymous letter with a meeting point. However, Mr Magoo mistakes the letter for a treasure map...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo, who is on the roof of a building, believes he's by the sea - when he dives in to save a drowning swimmer (in reality, a statue in a traffic circle) he is struck by Fizz's laser and then becomes weightless.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo replaces his friend Serge for the day as a personal trainer - while he thinks he's giving a swimming lesson at the pool, he appears at Weasel's house at the worst moment: for the first time in his life, Fizz is out of ideas...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Having written a book on the subject, Gena agrees to train Lloyd in how to survive outdoors, but Lloyd is disappointed to discover that all the training is to take place indoors.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Abacus is targeted by The Louse Hunter, a ruthless louse spider who loves the thrill of the hunt, Lloyd steps up to the challenge of protecting his best friend. On this occasion, however, Abacus may not need his help...

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: Comedy arts and crafts show presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bursting with unique makes, top tips and inspirational art ideas, Bec experiments with recycled materials and uses her funny bones to make us laugh along the way. Bec has been asked by her neighbour to look after a pet called Fluffy. Plus, a customer calls to ask for an arty delivery to help keep her dog toys organised.

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to actress Judy Parfitt and actors Larry Lamb and Adam Garcia, while former jockey Bob Champion introduces him to some Shetland ponies, and Andy Clarke pairs artisan chocolates with the best of British alcohol

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by TV and radio presenter Gloria Hunniford and demonstrates recipes for carrot cake, creme caramel and spatchcock chicken. There are also dishes from chefs Pip Lacey and Nieves Barragan and chocolatier Mark Tilling shares some of his creations

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team of horticultural experts come to the aid of Carol Nwosu, whose 16-year-old son has sickle cell anaemia. As well as caring for Danny, Carol runs a charity supporting families with children who also have the blood disorder, while battling crippling arthritis herself. Alan's plan is to make the Nwosus' tiny south London plot seem larger and provide them with a space that addresses all their needs

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a council clerk, Barnaby and Jones discover he was an expert blackmailer. Meanwhile, Joyce is convinced a local farmer knows more than he is telling. Julia McKenzie and Grant Masters guest star, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver suggests it would be mutually beneficial if he and Simon were to stop feuding and go into partnership, but he has an ulterior motive in mind

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver agree to undertake a stock check, but deceit and greed are the order of the day. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Danny and Kim vow to keep their romance secret, Sally helps emphysema sufferer Jack turn his life around and Nathan's leaving party is disrupted when Megan goes into labour. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The townsfolk are still coming to terms with Sally's death, while Danny and Cady move into Kim's house to make space for the Boothes - leading to a declaration of love. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective sets out for Norfolk when a country publican begs him to help solve a murder - but is disappointed when the innkeeper turns out to be a budding author and the killing fictional. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Jack Douglas, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw, Joan Sims and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Carry On Again Doctor (1969)

Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Jim Dale, Barbara Windsor, Charles Hawtrey, Hattie Jacques, Pat Coombs and Joan Sims

programme.title: Carry On Up the Jungle (1970)
programme.desc: A Victorian explorer recalls how he was recruited by an aristocrat to find her missing son in the African jungle. Comedy, starring Sid James, Frankie Howerd, Joan Sims, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Terry Scott

Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Pam Ferris

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Disaster! Mo is unwittingly recorded on the school's surveillance camera while using a power. Fortunately for our duo, Mo isn't recognisable on the video. JC announces he is the superhero on camera! He declares his 'superhero' name is 'Swatteroo The Sublime' and that he's gifted with astonishing super powers.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo asks the Spectral Sceptre for the power to zap the boring moments in his favourite series and find out what happens in the end - the result? Whenever anyone talks to him for more than five seconds, he fast-forwards to a later moment in the day! Mo enjoys zapping all those boring moments at first, but he soon realises that his buddy Lenny is now in big trouble because of him...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam's hymn about PDRAs is turned down by an animal welfare website. It must be said that Sam recorded herself on her own, playing a mouth-harp and the result was far from impressive. Stella sees how bad her friend feels about the rejection, even if Sam insists that she has moved onto another project. Stella decides to surprise her with another recording, a rock version of the hymn, convinced that this version will be accepted by the website.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

In order to avoid eating these culinary horrors, Sam and Mo ask the Spectral Scepter for the power to produce any food of their choice. However, their half-power turns everything they touch into vegetables! Which gets Sam in a real pickle when she convinces herself that, as a result of that power, she has turned Stella into a carrot!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

programme.desc: The father and son take on a challenging winter season. Pursuing his dream lifestyle, their neighbour Niall decides to build a home using clay harvested from his land. Mining for clay is new to the team and Sarah finds herself responsible for transporting this precious cargo in the new track dumper. As the clay piles up Niall gives the whole team a lesson in traditional wattle and daub construction on a wall of his hand-built compost toilet

programme.title: The Mysterious Murder of Ann Heron
programme.desc: The shocking story behind one of the UK's most mysterious unsolved crimes, as Peter Heron himself gives his version of the events surrounding his wife Ann's death in 1990. As the documentary explores the events of August 1990 in detail, new potential evidence comes to light, and questions are asked about whether the police missed a vital clue and chillingly, whether the real killer of Ann Heron escaped justice?

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Documentary examining the fatal stabbing of 21-year-old motorist Stephen Cameron during an escalated occurrence of road rage on the M25 in 1996. A two-year investigation into the altercation resulted in the extradition of the driver, Kenneth Noye, from Spain, who was later sentenced to life imprisonment

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Part two of two. The last-ever episode of the sitcom sees the pals facing major changes. There is a surprise in store for Monica and Chandler when Erica finally gives birth to the child they are planning to adopt. Phoebe and Mike decide to start a family of their own and Rachel gets set to begin a new life in Paris, though an unexpected farewell kiss from Ross might just change her mind. Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer star

programme.title: Tribal Teens
programme.desc: British teenagers get the wake-up call of a lifetime as they are challenged to live among the world's toughest tribes, tasked to survive in some of the planet's most extreme and hostile environments. Unmotivated 18-year-old Ethan and 16-year-old pampered princess Alex are flown deep into the Peruvian rainforest, home of the Ashaninka tribe. There are no let-ups, no lie-ins and no luxury as the pair are forced to forage for food in the oppressively humid conditions with only the most basic of living conditions provided

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: For 17 years from 1981 to 1998, the Humber Bridge was the longest single-span suspension bridge in the world, and many consider it to be Britain's most beautiful. Rob Bell discovers the facts about its groundbreaking construction, why it took so long to build and how it changed the lives of the people of Hull and North Lincolnshire

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice presents a compilation of advice from past episodes, visiting an Edinburgh home suffering from a surfeit of personality, a Victorian residence in Chester that needs restoring to its former glory and a Derbyshire cottage with rather too many stuffed animals for its own good

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Pip and Posy

programme.title: Paw Patrol

Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Megamind (2010)
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again (2018)
programme.desc: A sinister cyber attack reveals the identity of all active undercover agents in Britain. Hapless secret agent Johnny English is sent on a mission to the South of France to protect Queen and country, and find the mastermind hacker responsible. Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: The Grey (2011)
programme.desc: Eight oil rig workers end up stranded in the middle of the Alaskan tundra when the plane flying them home crashes. With limited supplies, they must make a gruelling journey across the icy wilderness to civilisation, but their situation is made more perilous when a pack of ferocious wolves begins stalking them. Adventure, starring Liam Neeson, Frank Grillo and Dermot Mulroney

programme.title: The Predator (2018)
programme.desc: When a young boy accidentally signals the galaxy's most lethal hunters who set course for Earth, an eclectic band of former soldiers and a scientist attempt to prevent the end of the human race. Director Shane Black's fourth entry in the sci-fi thriller saga, starring Boyd Holbrook, Trevante Rhodes, Jacob Tremblay, Keegan-Michael Key and Olivia Munn

programme.title: Sea Fever (2019)
programme.desc: A shy, aspiring marine biologist and the crew of an Irish trawler run into an unseen object, and are soon marooned at sea. Before long, they are fighting for survival as they tackle a parasite in their water supply. Director Neasa Hardiman's thriller, starring Connie Nielsen, Dougray Scott and Hermione Corfield

programme.title: Getting Personal
programme.desc: In this episode of Getting Personal, Deepa meets Mary Whittaker to find out how she became Scotland's first Deaf BSL minister.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda (2008)
programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure (2005)
programme.desc: Two squabbling brothers with time on their hands decide to play a mysterious old board game after finding it in their basement. A chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

programme.title: Pacific Rim: Uprising (2018)
programme.desc: Ten years after the Pan Pacific Defense Corps unleashed an army of Jaegers - 25-storey tall robots operated by mind-melded humans - former pilot Jake Pentecost is contacted by estranged sister Mako Mori. She implores him to return to the PPDC to head off the threat posed by Liwen Shao, chief executive of Shao Industries, who intends to replace the Jaegers with unmanned drones. Haunted by ghosts of the past, Jake eventually agrees to mentor a 15-year-old cadet called Amara, whose family were crushed to death during one monster attack. Director Steven S DeKnight's literally blockbusting sci-fi sequel, starring John Boyega, Scott Eastwood and Cailee Spaeny

programme.title: Peppermint (2018)
programme.desc: LA banker Riley sets out on a one-woman vengeance mission after her husband and daughter are killed on the order of a powerful drug lord and the criminals escape punishment, but events spiral out of control. Revenge thriller, starring Jennifer Garner, Jeff Hephner and Juan Pablo Raba

programme.title: Colombiana (2011)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old Colombian girl witnesses the murder of her parents at the hands of gangsters, but is rescued by her uncle, who takes her to the US and raises her to be a cold-blooded killer. Years later, she is still working for him as an assassin, but is secretly planning to avenge her parents' deaths. Action thriller, starring Zoe Saldana, Cliff Curtis, Michael Vartan and Lennie James

programme.title: Brother (2000)

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild (2003)

However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry

programme.title: Shrek the Third (2007)

Preferring to stay at home in the swamps, he sets out on a quest to find the rightful heir - a rebellious teenager named Artie - and persuade him to face up to his responsibilities as the future king. Meanwhile, the ambitious Prince Charming sees his chance to take the throne. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Masters of the Universe (1987)

programme.title: Mysterious Island (1961)

Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell

Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

Jack Reacher discovers that Turner has been targeted by a secret government conspiracy, and together they go on the run to expose the truth. Director Edward Zwick's blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Child's novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

He gets a confusing call from a woman named Iben, who appears to be in immediate danger after being abducted by her partner. Asger tries to piece together where she is and how to get help to her. Writer/director Gustav Moller's crime drama, starring Jakob Cedergren. In Danish with English subtitles

Plus, Sheldon's Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil finds himself in an awkward situation when he meets his former high-school girlfriend, who confesses she still has feelings for him, while Mitchell stands up to his boss and Jay summons up the courage to confess he killed Manny's turtle

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.desc: Holt allows Santiago and Peralta to house-sit for him while he visits Kevin in Paris, but mayhem ensues when Holt's beloved dog, Cheddar, goes missing on their watch. A romantic fling between Adrian Pimento and Diaz disrupts life at the precinct, disgusting their co-workers

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, guest starring June Squibb

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Pete maintains he makes the best pizza in town - based on a review from the 1980s - but the fiery chef's own taste test proves the opposite. With Pete's wife Paulette and son Josh threatening to leave, can Gordon get through to him and save the business?

programme.desc: Bernadette asks Leonard about his physics experiment, making Howard so jealous that she threatens to end their relationship. Penny also feels put out by the situation, and asks Sheldon to teach her about science. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch star

programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.desc: Diaz enlists Peralta to help change Jeffords' disapproving opinion about her fast-moving relationship with Pimento. However, the new couple's love for each other has to be put on hold when Pimento comes to believe that someone from his past is trying to kill him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the friends find out about Bernadette's big news, they celebrate by getting together for an evening of karaoke. However, Bernadette is upset when Howard freaks out over her announcement as he becomes convinced that he needs to start earning more money. Comedy, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the 200th episode of the comedy, the gang finally celebrates Sheldon's birthday after more than nine years together, with the help of a few special guests. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tells Penny he loves her, but fails to get the response he would have liked. Sheldon also finds himself competing against Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Wil Wheaton once again when the gang goes bowling - and tries to get his revenge

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to hide the fact he had dinner with Penny after she broke up with Leonard, hoping to stay friends with her. programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.desc: After dating men, 26-year-old dog groomer Nico has realised she's barking up the wrong tree and actually prefers women. She's hoping to find her the perfect partner able to get her all hot under the collar. Self-confessed 'bad girl' Patrice has now seen the light and turned to God. All the 26-year-old care worker needs now is that 'special fella' to take her to Heaven. Anna Richardson hosts the show in which potential dates bare all bit by bit in a bid to prove they are the ideal partner

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Maitre d' Fred hosts a special festive party in which he welcomes back some of the couples who found love in the restaurant, as well as three unlucky daters returning for a second chance at romance. Supermarket worker Luke, fireman Paul and eccentric theology student Louisa are all determined not to be left alone under the mistletoe by the end of the night, while the successful pairings are all happy to be back at the place they found love - and when one of the lovers surprises their partner by getting down on one knee, it makes it a Christmas they will never forget

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The couples embark on a relationship retreat to experience life together outside of their apartments. Hugo overhears a conversation that makes him re-evaluate his relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj finds himself in the middle of a domestic drama when he realises that the woman he's dating, Nell, has a husband, Oliver, who is very upset about their new relationship. Sheldon rents his old room back to have a quiet place to work and drives Leonard crazy by being a model tenant

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica returns from spring break intent on finding out where she stands with Geoff, while Adam's plan to get Dave Kim a date for senior prom backfires

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Geoff plans to surprise Erica with a marriage proposal, but miscommunications and misunderstandings between their friends and family put things in peril

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke recalls the impressive works of engineering people have achieved with their vehicles - from the scrap Learjet turned into a luxury garden studio to the restoration of the only surviving British mobile cinema truck. Plus, the 1950s railway carriage that was converted into a three-bedroom home and an incredibly stylish custom-designed jeep transformed into a cocktail bar

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties. The team meet Simon and Lisa, who recently bought a building in rural Gloucestershire in such a shoddy state that neighbours compared it to the house in Amityville Horror. George teams the couple up with creative architect Laura Clark, who attempts to turn this terrifying building into a warm and welcoming, modern home, whilst retaining some of its original character

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke meets single father Rick, whose four-storey terrace in Stratford-upon-Avon has just one room per floor and is totally impractical when his children come to stay. Can the architect come up with a clever redesign to create space and much-needed character? He also helps single mum Donna in Hastings, whose Victorian double reception room has not been touched for 50 years

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salesman Richard Massey hosts the first party in Colchester, hoping his cheeky-chappy demeanour and signature dish Drunken Duck will be enough to see him walk away with the £1,000 prize at the end of the week-long competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PR worker Darius G Laws hosts the second dinner party in Colchester, but knows he will have to work hard after being critical the previous evening. He creates a menu filled with local ingredients and home-grown produce, including his own blackberry wine, and hopes his Roman dress code will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American army wife Adrena Austin hosts the third dinner party in Colchester. She hopes her simple menu, which revisits her Armenian heritage, will be a welcome change for her guests, but while reactions to the main course are mixed, her entertainment proves a resounding success

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: James Coe throws the fourth party in Colchester, and his choice of menu proves popular from the starter onwards. However, Jodie Ezekiel finds his incessant discussion of money somewhat off-putting. Fortunately, the prospect of a dip in the host's hot tub improves moods, and gives Darius G Laws a chance to show off his pink pants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jodie Edzekiel hosts the final dinner party in Colchester, and tries to please her guests by serving them meat, provided she can bring herself to touch it. When Jodie's planned entertainment lets her down, she hopes a sing-a-long with her accompanying on the organ will save the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jon and Julia Shorrock host the first round of the B&B competition from their four-star Derwent House in West Sussex. The guests are split by gender to sample the area, with the men firing machine guns at a shooting range and the women relaxing at a spa - but a carpeted bathroom and shower without hot water raise questions

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Peter and Sharron Sorsky invite their fellow competitors to Kirkby Park B&B in Liverpool, but the presence of a security camera on the outside of the house leaves one guest feeling uneasy. Room inspections uncover all manner of unsightly problems, but a tour of nearby Knowsley Safari Park gives the contestants a chance to enjoy themselves

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Julian Banner-Price host the competition at their expensive B&B Plas Dinas Country House in Snowdonia, giving their new guests the priciest rooms. Peter and Sharron Sorsky are still reeling from their feedback forms and immediately find fault with the accommodation, and the group is taken to wash bedding the old-fashioned way at the local slate museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Annette McAnespie welcomes the group to Hazelwood Farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, for the final B&B visit. The initial impressions are favourable and Peter and Jon begin to bond for the first time during a mosaic class, but not everyone feels up to the planned activity of a cycling tour

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time at Annette McAnespie's farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health-conscious grandmother Tina Ainsworth hosts the first dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, putting on a Chinese-themed evening for her guests - croupier Tomasz Wisniewski, PR consultant Julia Smith, copy writer Rachel Imms and DJ Gareth Harding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Croupier Tomasz Wisniewski hosts the second dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire. His 'outrageous'-themed evening leaves plenty of scope for his guests' imaginations, but his balloon-pumping competition brings out the competitive streak in one contestant

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Gareth Harding hosts the third dinner party from Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, where he provides an Ibiza-themed night after he transforms his garden into a Balearic cocktail bar and club complete with lasers and disco lights. The guests seem impressed with the host's sophisticated menu, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew as he attempts to cook a tricky beef Wellington

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Animal lover Rachel Imms hosts the fourth party of the week from Mansfield. She opts for a French-themed evening, but her complicated main course proves to be a challenge, and her accordionist entertainer does not appeal to everyone in the way she had hoped

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance fanatic Julia Smith hosts the final party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, and is confident she will wow fellow competitors with her fancy house and hospitality, having roped in two waiters to give the evening a touch of class. A spot of salsa dancing proves entertaining for all the wrong reasons, and as the event draws to a close, the contestants gather to discover which dinner was rated the best

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Stephan, 39, is rushed to St George's with internal bleeding from his femoral artery, caused by complications following an angiogram he had the day before, and doctors are concerned his heart could be under potentially fatal strain. Nineteen-year-old Emmanuel Jr arrives in A&E after suffering an acute sickle cell crisis, and his mum Elizabeth talks about the impact the condition has had on the family, while 40-year-old Fernanda is admitted with abdominal pain, but the test results reveal a surprising reason for her discomfort

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is high on drugs and has been found by police sitting in a doorway with a badly broken arm. A first day at work ends badly for a member of security staff at a nightclub, as he moves awkwardly and dislocates his knee. A man who's on blood thinners falls off his mobility scooter and hits his head. With the risk of a bleed on the brain, he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun attends his first full day at St Bonaventure Hospital, although the attention to detail that comes with his autism throws a few spanners into the works

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The medics race to patients injured on beaches and rivers. A boating accident on the Norfolk Broads leaves holiday-maker Carol with a partially amputated foot, and 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is high on drugs and has been found by police sitting in a doorway with a badly broken arm. A man who's on blood thinners falls off his mobility scooter and hits his head. With the risk of a bleed on the brain, he needs to go to hospital
