programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty journeys to Japan to unleash the power of wasabi, Matt Tebbutt finds out which foods generate the most wind, and Kate Quilton asks if there is there really any difference between dog and cat food

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Hertfordshire couple Phil and Geraldine can't wait to retire and spend more time with their six children and grandchildren. To kick-start this next phase of their life they want a new place to call home. However, while Phil wants to live in beautiful east Devon, Geraldine has fallen for the Gallic charm of Bergerac in the south of France. Jonnie Irwin flies the flag for the UK by showing Phil and Geraldine three properties in east Devon for their UK budget of £375,000, while Jasmine Harman reveals the best Bergerac can offer for their away budget of £275,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A straight-talking hairdresser from London tries to cut it as Costa Blanca's newest stylist and newlyweds start a new life as holiday hosts in the south of France

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien turn an old, unloved filing cabinet into a valuable and desirable storage unit and convert a Bakelite voltmeter into a retro Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more gems hidden among unwanted possessions, trying to make a profit from church organ pipes and old leather sports car seats

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of a man with links to 19th-century South Africa, while other members of the team search for the brother of a former Birmingham resident. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are yet to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The sports car-themed PitStop in Hertfordshire hosts the first round, as owners Melvyn and Sindy Rutter try to make a good impression. However, the absence of tea and coffee in the rooms does not go down well with the guests, and Melvyn's after-dinner talk about his collection of Morgan cars fails to spark much interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill and Peter Tydie invite their fellow competitors to stay at the Victory in Mersea, Essex, a four-star B&B with 26 members of staff to run the bar, restaurant and accommodation. A trip to a local fishery gives one contestant an opportunity to annoy his peers, and the discovery of a hole in a bedsheet leaves the hosts feeling uneasy about their chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave Botha hosts at his Butterfly Paragliding B&B on the Isle of Wight. Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham are unhappy they must sleep in a tepee in the garden and use an outdoor toilet, and claim they were served watery eggs and rubbery sausages for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham host the final night at Braddon Hall in Torquay, Devon, where Melvyn and Sindy take issue with their squeaky four-poster bed. The hoteliers try to entertain their guests by inviting them to take part in an archery contest - which ends in accusations of unfair play

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. One of the hosts gets upset about large underpayments and a couple interrogate their guests about the criticism in their feedback, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer travels back to Cambridgeshire to catch up with a couple he and Kirstie Allsopp first met three years ago when they were struggling with what to do with their three-bed semi. Amber Brammah, who was leading fitness classes from the garage, wanted a new house with more room to run her business, while ecologist husband Martin preferred the idea of renovating. Having made their decision, how have things changed in the 36 months since?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Matt and Lucia's house in Royal Wootton Bassett, Wiltshire, is bulging at the seams, as it is home to not only them but three grown-up children from previous relationships. Matt loves it but Lucia does not, so while Kirstie Allsopp tries to change the layout, Phil Spencer finds some alternative properties. But will the family choose to up sticks or stay where they are?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim battles to get a fence built for their marauding flock of 25 sheep, and Krys battles to balance the books. They race to get their chateau ready for their first paying guests as Lee struggles with a chandelier. Elaine and David continue the search for their dream property, visiting a 17th-century ex-priory in Normandy and taking on board all that Dick has taught them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Professional deep-sea diver Adrian Corrigall and his wife Megan plan to build their new family home in rural East Sussex almost entirely out of concrete, with construction involving cutting-edge technologies conceived in Switzerland and never used to build a house before. However, the perils of being a pioneer soon become evident, and with both schedule and budget under strain, Adrian is forced to resume work as a diver, taking him away from the project for a month at a time

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: A guide to luxury train rides across Britain, beginning with the steam-hauled Saphos train on the Devonshire coast. Train manager Sandra and her hospitality team help a passenger surprise his wife of 40 years with a special anniversary present, while executive chef Nick creates a sumptuous five-course meal and learner steam train driver Ian clocks up more training hours passing alongside the red rock coast

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates a look at some of the fiercest rivalries between British chocolate bar manufacturers, revealing the lengths companies went to in a bid to make their product the nation's favourite. Featuring contributions from the brains behind the brands

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Michelle, who's 54, is airlifted to St George's after being involved in a car crash with her husband Paul in Surrey. She was given a blood transfusion at the scene and doctors work quickly to get her to CT to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Cameras also follow Derren, 41, who has fractured his ankle while trampolining with his 12-year-old daughter, Macie

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: A guide to luxury train rides across Britain, beginning with the steam-hauled Saphos train on the Devonshire coast. Train manager Sandra and her hospitality team help a passenger surprise his wife of 40 years with a special anniversary present, while executive chef Nick creates a sumptuous five-course meal and learner steam train driver Ian clocks up more training hours passing alongside the red rock coast

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, inviting Sean Lock and Rob Beckett to take on Jon Richardson and Claudia Winkleman. Nick Mohammed and Joe Wilkinson join wordsmith Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while maths whizz Rachel Riley looks after the numbers

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Michelle, who's 54, is airlifted to St George's after being involved in a car crash with her husband Paul in Surrey. She was given a blood transfusion at the scene and doctors work quickly to get her to CT to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Cameras also follow Derren, 41, who has fractured his ankle while trampolining with his 12-year-old daughter, Macie

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates whether protein supplements help build better bodies and also heads to Japan to learn about wasabi. Matt Tebbutt exposes the potential dangers of consuming grapefruit while on certain medications, and finds out which foods generate the most wind, while Kate Quilton lifts the lid on peanut butter's shelf life, and asks if there is really any difference between dog and cat food

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Jenny Eclair are challenged to make Kimono-style garments against the clock

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton show Neil and Sarah Marks properties in Carcassonne and Wiltshire, as they look to settle down following Neil's retirement

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A London hairdresser takes on her first member of staff, and the pressure is on for a retired major and his wife as they become holiday hosts

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole calls in a locksmith to bring a safe back from the scrapheap, and a ship's wheel is left in splinters when the presenter falls out with restorer Guy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo travel the length of Britain seeking items to fix up, flog on and sell for profit. Max upcycles a brass propeller into a stylish table lamp, while Henry goes all Victorian with an old pond yacht

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers investigate the case of Victor Evans from Bedford who died at the age of 88, but the common surname proves a real headache for them. A Victorian school in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, produces a massive windfall and an unusual challenge for the team

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and Shirley Boyle, owners of the Old Hall Country House in Madeley, Cheshire, host the week's first round of the B&B competition. The guests are impressed by the 16th-century building, and are taken tap-dancing and to a private fine-dining restaurant, but one of them is dissatisfied with her bedroom's layout and the garnish on her eggs at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are the third hosts, at their three-bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, Cornwall. For the activity they arrange a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. Some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room but the food is a success, and Eileen Finn demonstrates her karate skills on the men

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Cavendish in Bournemouth, run by Tim and Karen Sturgess. On arrival, the competitors are impressed by the 'pink palace', but things go downhill when a bed is broken and one couple are allocated a room next to the front door. However, Eileen is delighted by the feline memorabilia in her room and the group enjoys a spot of indoor paint-balling and an open-top bus tour of the resort

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is surprised by an overpayment and Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley receives tough criticism, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple of doctors in need of a property re-think. Their three-bedroom Victorian semi in Newcastle is not working for them and their two young daughters. Kathleen loves the location and reckons the house could be made to work, but Tom wants to sell up and pursue a better life in the country.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Belinda travels to Dick and Angel's chateau so that Angel can teach her the art of decoupage on a classic 1950s family dressing table. It's changeover day at Krys and Tim's chateau, as they sweat it out in 42-degree heat to get their 20-room chateau ready for their next booking. Budding chateau owners Elaine and David visit a 19th-century chateau with 18 rooms and two gîtes in Normandy

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Aaron, 31, is rushed to St George's after overturning his car onto metal railings during a high-speed collision. He has a serious laceration to his face where a spiked railing narrowly missed his eye socket. Cameras also follow Fiona, 65, who is rushed to the hospital after falling over in a restaurant and cutting her knee during her friend Evelyn's 70th birthday party

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: After multiple heart-breaking miscarriages, Jenny is in the Rotunda hoping for a good outcome with this pregnancy. Also in the hospital, it was 'love at first swipe' for young couple Michaela and Mark, who are taking a step into the unknown as they become parents for the first time. Elsewhere, Bulgarian couple Rose and Slavi arrive from Kildare just in time for the speedy arrival of their baby girl, while Joyce discovers she is about to become a mother to triplets

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is high on drugs and has been found by police sitting in a doorway with a badly broken arm. A first day at work ends badly for a member of security staff at a nightclub, as he moves awkwardly and dislocates his knee. A man who's on blood thinners falls off his mobility scooter and hits his head. With the risk of a bleed on the brain, he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A freak car accident in Cumbria leaves Richard fighting for his life. In Hampshire, horse rider Pat takes a nasty fall when her animal is spooked. Plus, in a night mission in Suffolk, the medics race to the aid of motorcyclist Nigel who has suffered serious multiple injuries

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni Charalambous and his team customise a Jaguar F-Type sports car, before the jet-setting owner Arjun heads off on a road trip to Monaco

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race: World's Greatest Moments
programme.desc: Teams of amateur racers have built and raced soapbox vehicles all over the world - relive some of the greatest moments from the all-action wacky races

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event in London, as amateur drivers put their home-made, gravity-powered vehicles through an obstacle-littered course. The judges for the event at Alexandra Palace were snowboarder Katie Ormerod, racing driver Andrew Jordan, grime artist Blakie and 2015 Red Bull Soapbox Race podium finisher Tony Whitelaw, while contestants included Team Brooklands Special, 24 Seconds of Le Ally Pally and Team Rockin' Rolla

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's payment day, and one set of B&Bers in particular are sharpening their knives ready to debate what they felt was some very unfair feedback. After the dust has settled, all participants learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth uses all of his property expertise to find Robert and Thomas their perfect holiday home in and around La Mata in south east Spain. programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back to some of their favourite properties from the show and offers tips and tricks to help viewers make the best of their homes. In this episode, the duo tackle future-proofing, as two families at very different stages of their lives tackle tricky renovations in a last-ditch attempt to make their homes work for the long term

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George gets to celebrate one of his favourite periods of British architecture when he helps out at an arts and crafts Edwardian terrace house in Addiscombe, south London. Cookie and Sophia bought their home six months ago, but, despite it being full to the brim with amazing original features, from fireplaces to balustrades and stained-glass windows, it needed some serious TLC. This renovation is a labour of love as the couple set about painstakingly restoring the features by themselves. programme.desc: The final night of the competition in Aberdeen finds journalist Turid hoping her home-grown produce will tantalise her guests' taste buds. Can Turid knock Sylvian off the top spot and walk away with the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: The tale of an elderly couple whose hopes of a peaceful retirement were ruined when their tenants stopped paying rent, then moved in their abusive friends who became squatters. With the house becoming a free-for-all and in a terrible state of repair, and the couple facing a barrage of verbal threats and abusive behaviour, they have been forced to seek help in an attempt to get their property back. Plus, a man who cannot sell his house because his sitting tenant refuses to leave

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: In Bristol, eviction lawyer Chris deals with a complex case in which squatters have broken into an empty pub and are now refusing to leave, with landlord Alex wanting them out as he is awaiting planning permission to turn the pub into flats. Jill is trying to regain a property she and her late husband bought as an investment, which she has been renting out to alleviate financial stress

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. On the southern border of North Yorkshire, some more youngsters catch the eye of the traffic cops when it appears the driver is using a mobile phone. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. The police conduct a raid on a house near York, on the hunt for a suspected drug dealer, while a routine patrol takes a sinister turn when a man in a bar is spotted with a knife

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An 80mph pursuit carries on for 15 miles across North Yorkshire, while wet roads make a 90mph chase near Scarborough even more dangerous. Another pursuit is aborted when the driver pulls over to relieve himself, and officers find an open crate of lager in his car. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Twenty-five miles north of York, Julian is called to the scene of a crash in which a car careered off the road and hit a tree, with the driver pronounced dead at the scene. Elsewhere, officers disturb two suspects they believe have been carrying out break-ins leading to a 100mph chase across a golf course

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An elderly woman near York has collapsed in her bathroom, jamming the door shut. Near the Yorkshire Dales, an elderly man driving without his glasses is responsible for a hit and run. And in Filey, North Yorkshire, a people-carrier has collided with a mobility scooter. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jimmy and his dog Boas find a dangerous weapon, while Kev and Pete are involved in a high-speed pursuit. An armed response team is called out to deal with a drunken man brandishing a gun, while Andy is confronted with am aggressive drink driver refusing to take a breath test

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Paul Jackson has his work cut out stopping a runaway van driver who is causing havoc, while a street disturbance leads Paul Faulkner and Lee Wilson to stare down the barrels of a shotgun. Plus, Kev Salter and the team raid a cannabis farm and make a shocking discovery

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ian Stapley pursues a trail of sparks left by a car thief with a burst front tyre, while Jacko heads up the firearms team as they look for two men seen in possession of a sawn-off shotgun. Shadow the police dog nearly takes a bite of a barricaded burglar and Kev Salter deals with a heroin user who hides her stash in a hard-to-reach place

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter takes drastic action to stop a vehicle he suspects has class-A drugs on board, while a nasty street fight leads to a Taser being drawn. Mark Shepherd has his work cut out when a late-night pursuit heads off-road, and the arrest of a wanted man leads to drugs and a lethal weapon being discovered

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Surrey Police are surprised when a learner motorcyclist pulls a dangerous wheelie on the road in front of them and, upon pulling over the biker, they uncover more violations. It's a day of action in Telford as the DVLA, local council and police join forces to rid the streets of untaxed vehicles. Enforcement officers Jo and Rowhan swoop in to seize a car that has been untaxed for 10 months, but the owner is keen to drive it away

programme.title: Evil Up Close: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: The case of Stephen Hough, who brutally killed an innocent schoolgirl in 1976 when he was just 16. But in a shocking turn of events, he was caught and sent to prison 41 years later

programme.title: The Girl in the Cellar: 8 Years Underground
programme.desc: For the first time, Natascha Kampusch tells the harrowing story of her abduction as a 10-year-old in Vienna in 1998, and the 3,096 days she spent held captive in a secret basement.. Natascha speaks openly about her horrific experiences, and reveals how the conspiracy theories and lack of public empathy have impacted her life in the years following her ordeal

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: After a student is found dead in his car, investigators suspect his girlfriend's brother to be the culprit until he's spotted on CCTV across town at the time of the murder, leaving detectives struggling to unravel a sordid, and lethal, family plot

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Why cameras are proving useful when it comes to controlling rowdy football fans on trains. Plus, footage of angry drivers violently attacking cyclists

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: The medics help a woman who ended up in hospital after too much exercise and dieting, a Cardiff woman with a bowel problem and a singer who sweats too much

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Will it all prove to be pie in the sky? Caravan site boss Bambi and her neighbour Johnny, who is also her former dance partner, try to rekindle their old magic at the campsite charity fete. Taffy and Leanne have set up their own pool maintenance business - but it's their own pool that is causing them the biggest headache

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Following the work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The programme follows officers from Derbyshire's road crime unit as they target dealers bringing drugs into the county, with PC Nick Lovatt giving chase after a sighting of a suspected dealer in Derby. At police HQ, the cops receive intelligence about a van travelling towards Derbyshire suspected of carrying a large amount of cash. The Road Crime Unit heads into position to intercept the van and surround it on the motorway

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Derbyshire's Road Crime Unit uses intelligence and surveillance tactics to crack down on suspected drug dealers. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jenno and Bucko race to assist when Jim is rammed by a runaway driver, while Dan and Gordy have to resort to physical force on a drunk who is menacing a family. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan and Gordy engage in the high-speed pursuit of a dangerous disqualified driver, while the big blue van is called in when a late-night scuffle spirals out of control, Jim's intuition is proven right after a routine stop reveals a secret stash, and the hunt is on for a wanted man in a bobble hat

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sean uses a manual battering ram on a raid on a drug dealer's house, while Jim's pursuit of a speeding driver leads to some narcotic-related discoveries and there is a high-speed chase through the streets of Macclesfield. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The pubs finally reopen after nearly four months of lockdown and as a result the police prepare for a spike in drink-drive incidents on Derbyshire's roads. programme.title: Columbo

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A terrorist posing as an Irish author heads a peace organization while secretly running guns for the IRA in Belfast. When he kills an arms dealer who tried to swindle him, the writer is sure he has covered his tracks - until Columbo shambles on to the scene. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Clive Revill, Jeanette Nolan and Bernard Behrens

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A penniless rare-plant collector, desperate for funds to support his expensive hobby, fakes his nephew's kidnapping to get his hands on a trust fund. However, the supposed victim turns up dead, prompting Columbo to take action to unmask the killer. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Bradford Dillman and Ray Milland

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A millionaire art collector is thought to have been killed as the result of a random burglary. However, Columbo is convinced the dead man's nephew committed the crime to avoid being written out of the will, and embarks on a mission to ensnare his suspect. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Ross Martin and Don Ameche

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A sex therapist tries to pin the blame for the murder of her unfaithful lover on her assistant, but the dishevelled detective is not convinced by the ruse and seeks to identify a mysterious woman in black who was spotted leaving the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Lindsay Crouse, Peter Jurasik and Julia Montgomery

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An inventor tries to stop his mother-in-law from exposing his infidelities by murdering her in front of a security camera - and tampering with the recording to make it look like the killing occurred at a time when he had an alibi. However, Columbo sees through his hi-tech ruse and tries to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Oskar Werner and Gena Rowlands

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A wealthy man due to marry a younger woman is electrocuted in the bath. Columbo suspects the victim's identical twin nephews - a flamboyant TV chef and a conservative banker - who stand to inherit his fortune if he died unmarried, but the detective is unsure which of them is the guilty party. Drama, starring Peter Falk, and Martin Landau in a dual role. With Paul Stewart, Julie Newmar and Jeanette Nolan

programme.title: Murder in the First
programme.desc: The inspectors search for ways to link the suspects to the Cindy Strauss's murder, while Hildy is confronted by a young witness in a past case who is worried for his mother's safety after she is physically abused by her new husband. Starring Taye Diggs, Kathleen Robertson and Tom Felton

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A suspect in the murder of a Mob lawyer's wife dies while being restrained by Stabler, who maintains he did nothing wrong. Drama, guest starring Cary Elwes (The Princess Bride, Saw), with Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A mother is accused of killing her missing one-year-old baby, and becomes so distraught that she commits suicide. Guest starring Pablo Schreiber (The Wire)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

As the case proceeds, a new suspect is identified, but the evidence against him is thrown out in court - and events build to a tragic conclusion. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Connie Nielsen

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: The officers leap into action when a financial planner is killed in her apartment building. Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd

programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw

programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.desc: The discovery of a murdered man in a graveyard leads Munch to discover he was a rent boy, who had recently made calls to a church known for its notorious anti-gay beliefs. The institution's founder confesses to the crime as the evidence mounts against him, but the detectives suspect he is taking the blame for someone else. Crime drama, starring Richard Belzer

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Novak tries to track down Benson, whose testimony is vital to the successful outcome of a rape prosecution - but she is living under the assumed identity of a green activist and has infiltrated a group suspected of being eco-terrorists. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A distinctive tattoo on the body of a dead teenage girl leads Stabler and Beck to a foster home - which proves to be a cover for a child-prostitution ring. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a marine working for the Defence Intelligence Agency who was blamed for the disappearance of 500 specialised rifles in Afghanistan. A cryptic message found at the scene, written in the victim's blood, leads the agents on the trail of a controversial manuscript that claims to expose the truth about the missing weapons, and an FBI agent with a secret. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

Meanwhile, Ziva introduces her new boyfriend to her team-mates. Crime drama, guest starring Enrique Murciano

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A baby is found dead in his cot, and reports indicate he was poisoned. All the evidence pins the blame on a British au pair employed by the parents, but she claims the infant's death was a result of the mother's negligence. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe, Curtis, McCoy and Kincaid witness the execution of a criminal they helped bring to justice, but the event culminates in personal tragedies for each of them

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: First of a three-part story. The team investigates when the headless corpse of a film studio executive is found floating in a river, and her personal trainer and ex-husband soon prove likely suspects. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. When blood matching the dead film studio executive's is found in their new suspect's car, they soon arrest him but their case may not be clear-cut enough to warrant a conviction. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi's mother falls in love with a scientist from a planet where inhabitants are expected to die at 60, and persuades him to defy his people by living - unwittingly pushing the Enterprise to the brink of war. Guest starring Majel Barrett

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise
programme.desc: The ship becomes stranded in a Romulan minefield, forcing Reed to attempt a risky operation. Fifth sci-fi series in the Star Trek saga, starring Scott Bakula and Dominic Keating

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Part two of two. The crew continues its attempts to prevent a leading 20th-century industrialist from destroying the future. While trying to rescue Paris and Tuvok, Torres and Chakotay are captured by a gang of weapons smugglers convinced they are government agents. Kate Mulgrew stars

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team's efforts to track down 900lbs of stolen explosives are stalled when a bomb goes off in the city. The amount used still leaves the unknown terrorists with enough high explosive to level a large portion of the city. When Russo reveals Homeland Security knew the attack was orchestrated by a gang of South African mercenaries, Brody is forced to question what her new lover's real agenda might be. The situation becomes even more awkward when it becomes clear Russo has been involved in a string of cases that resulted in mysterious fatalities. While Pride and Sonja head out in search of the remaining explosives, Brody works together with Patton and Sebastian to investigate her new boyfriend's credentials. Naval crime drama, guest starring Ivan Sergei

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick and Hank investigate when a child goes missing, uncovering several similar cases all linked by sightings of a mysterious ghostly presence. It transpires that the Weeping Woman - or La Llorona - is a ghost who kidnaps three children every Halloween and drowns them, hoping their sacrifice can atone for the loss of her own children, whom she also drowned. David Giuntoli stars

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: An alien extremist takes over the body of a Voyager crew member and heads for his home planet in a Federation shuttle, determined to attempt a political coup. Sci-fi adventure, starring Kate Mulgrew.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The naval crime drama spin-off returns, picking up with Pride and his team in the wake of the departure of Meredith Brody, who left for good after a close call with a terrorist. Concerns are raised about whether the unit has been irreparably compromised, and FBI special agent Tammy Gregorio is assigned to discover the truth. However, the agents are quickly given a chance to prove their effectiveness, as they co-ordinate with various other federal agencies to track down a sniper targeting special events across New Orleans. Starring Scott Bakula

programme.desc: What exactly makes a family in today's often complex world? Each episode features three unique families from around the world who live their lives in a less than conventional way!

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six is tricked into becoming the sheriff of a Western township called Harmony and soon discovers the place is nothing like its name suggests. He comes to the aid of a saloon girl, but his refusal to carry a gun is tested to the limit by a criminal called the Kid. Starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes at the Saint Patrick's Day Dog Expo in Dublin, and meets Leslie Burban who keeps African pygmy hedgehogs in Cork. Plus, a look at the work of a cat midwife, following Shadow the Siamese feline through her birthing plan

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Skomer Island, a seabird haven off the Pembrokeshire coast, and watches members of its puffin population returning from the sea with sand eels to feed their young. He also has a close encounter with the Skomer vole, which is not found anywhere else

programme.title: Aging in the Wild
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it is like for animals to grow old, looking at longevity, reproductive health, social status, wisdom and eventual death, as well as examining the unique challenges every species face in the ageing process

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part special. The women of Cranford are excited about the imminent visit of Lady Glenmire, until the Hon Mrs Jamieson announces that none of them is of high enough social standing to meet her - so Miss Matty leads the Amazons in snubbing both the newcomer and her hostess. But sociable Lady Glenmire is quick to offer an olive branch by hosting a memorable Halloween party, which results in the forging of new friendships. Mr Buxton is impressed by Edward Bell's ambitions, so takes him on as land agent, only for the new employee to make a disastrous decision that has dire consequences for both himself and his sister Peggy. Meanwhile, Matty is distressed when a surprising discovery about one of her close circle results in a serious falling out among the friends, and when tragedy strikes the town, she fears Cranford may never recover. Judi Dench, Celia Imrie and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Documentary exploring areas of the capital, beginning with Shooters Hill, Charlton, Greenwich and Blackheath

programme.title: Three Sisters (1970)
programme.desc: In a remote Russian estate, three sisters long to escape their unfulfilling routine and start new lives in Moscow. A brief respite comes in the shape of a charismatic army officer, but their brother's marriage to a domineering peasant woman jeopardises all their hopes for the future. Period drama based on Chekhov's play, with Joan Plowright and Derek Jacobi

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Blow Your Own Trumpet (1958)
programme.desc: A boy from a poor family longs to play the cornet in a local brass band, but has to contend with a wealthy rival. Children's drama, starring Michael Crawford and Peter Butterworth

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Wigmore Hall Classical Concerts
programme.desc: Wigmore Hall presents a special broadcast concert from leading brass ensemble Septura, performing works by Ravel, Debussy and Gershwin

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alpha crew makes contact with a planet inhabited by a group of robotic humans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary offers an insight into tests that reveal the IQs of dogs, and there is a look at the progress of some cats that are toilet-training. Plus, a canine that is preparing for a wedding, and the story of an eight-year-old girl and her special relationship with her feline

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits the New Forest in Hampshire, an area of ancient woodlands and heaths originally set aside for hunting by William the Conqueror. Ray explores its wildlife, including fallow deer and ponies, and has a night-time encounter with the elusive nightjar

programme.title: Sex and Chocolate
programme.desc: Comic drama, starring Dawn French as a teacher tempted to rekindle her romance with an old flame, despite being happily married to a kindly caretaker. With Phil Daniels and Michael Maloney

programme.title: Killing Dad (1989)
programme.desc: A drunken, out-of-work father writes to the family he abandoned 23 years before to say he wants to come home and ask their forgiveness. His estranged son is so alarmed that he sets off in a bid to kill his unwanted deadbeat dad before he has the chance to show up. Comedy, starring Denholm Elliott, Julie Walters, Richard E Grant and Anna Massey

programme.title: Triumph of the Spirit (1989)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about an Auschwitz prisoner who became the concentration camp's boxing champion in a series of fights held for the entertainment of Nazi officers. Starring Willem Dafoe, Robert Loggia and Edward James Olmos

programme.title: David Attenborough's Light on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough embarks on a search for the lights of nature, on a journey that will lead to ocean depths, claustrophobic caves and forests by night

programme.desc: The chef visits Somerset, where he samples a wide variety of local produce including fresh cod caught on the mud flats, and braised oxtail prepared by chef Gary Rhodes. He also examines the lunchtime offerings at his old school and prepares a dish of rabbit in gooseberry champagne in Frome

programme.title: The Tales of Hoffmann (1951)
programme.desc: Emeric Pressburger and Michael Powell's adaptation of Offenbach's opera about a poet reflecting on three women he loved and lost in the past - a mechanical performing doll, a Venetian courtesan, and the consumptive daughter of a celebrated composer. Starring Moira Shearer, Robert Rounseville, Robert Helpmann and Leonide Massine

programme.title: The Clue of the Missing Ape (1953)
programme.desc: Two children uncover a plot by a gang of crooks to blow up British ships that are harboured near Gibraltar. Children's adventure, starring George Cole and Nati Banda

programme.title: Space 1999

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh has always dreamed of having an edible garden, so when she and husband Jono decide to convert their house into a home, they start outdoors

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and her best friend Sarah have dreamt about opening their own market food stall since their days together at art school - and now that it's a reality

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Ali and Siobhan travel to Clare Meade's clinic from Kerry with their cat Hope, which is suffering from multiple ongoing issues due to neurological disorder Cerebellar Hypoplasia - also known as wobbly cat syndrome. A tabby is brought in by owners Eleanor and Anna from Lismore in Waterford as the cat is in severe pain and is unable to urinate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A postman is anxious to catch a morning showing of The Sound of Muzak at the local cinema. However, he is unaware a blue movie is actually to be shown and that his wife is its star. Comedy, written by and starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: White Collar Boxing League
programme.desc: Fast-paced adrenaline-filled White Collar Boxing from The WBCL. Fighting talk, getting up close and personal to the competitors in and out of the ring

programme.title: That'll Be the Day (1973)
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox

Thriller, starring James Coburn, Lee Grant, Harry Andrews and Ian Hendry

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh returns with the celebrity version of the team quiz show. As ever, four star contestants are challenged to pit their wits against one of the show's ruthless quiz experts, in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for their charity of choice. This time, Absolute Radio's Christian O'Connell, singer, TV presenter and vocal coach Carrie Grant, Channel 5 children's presenter Naomi Wilkinson and I, Daniel Blake star Dave Johns each try to race down the game board without being caught, before joining forces for the final chase

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate
